text: Response: After you raise your threat from the Doomed keyword, Isengard Messenger gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the round. (Limit twice per round.)
flavor: "I have an urgent errand," he said. "My news is evil." <cite>Radagast, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Westfold Outrider
text: Action: Discard Westfold Outrider to choose an enemy not engaged with you. Engage the chosen enemy.
flavor: "Erkenbrand of Westfold has drawn off those men he could gather towards his fastness at Helm's Deep. The rest are scattered." <cite>Rider of Rohan, The Two Towers</cite>

name: Westfold Horse-breeder
text: Response: After Westfold Horse-breeder enters play, search the top 10 cards of your deck for a Mount attachment and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
flavor: "They love their horses next to their kin." <cite>Boromir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Rohan Warhorse
text: Attach to a [tactics] or Rohan hero. Restricted. Response: After attached hero participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, exhaust Rohan Warhorse to ready attached hero.
flavor: Their horses were of great stature, strong and clean-limbed... <cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: Silver Lamp
text:
Attach to a [spirit] hero.
While attached hero is ready, shadow cards dealt to enemies engaged with you are dealt face up. (Shadow card effects are still resolved when resolving enemy attacks.)
flavor: ...one of them uncovered a small lamp that gave out a slender silver beam. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Keys of Orthanc
text: Attach to a hero. Response: After you raise your threat from the Doomed keyword, exhaust Keys of Orthanc to add 1 resource to attached hero's resource pool.
flavor: "He has the Key of Orthanc" <cite>Gandalf, The Two Towers</cite>

name: Legacy of Númenor
text: Doomed 4. Action: Add 1 resource to each hero's resource pool.
flavor: "...in the midst of that valley is a tower of stone called Orthanc. It was not made by Saruman, but by the Men of Númenor long ago: and it is very tall and has many secrets..." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Deep Knowledge
text: Doomed 2. Action: Each player draws 2 cards.
flavor: "His knowledge is deep, but his pride has grown with it..." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: The Wizards's Voice
text: Doomed 3. Action: Each player chooses 1 enemy engaged with him. Until the end of the phase, each chosen enemy cannot attack the player that chose it.
flavor: ...it was a delight to hear the voice speaking, all that it said seemed wise and reasonable... <cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: Power of Orthanc
text: Doomed 2. Action: Each player may choose and discard a Condition attachment from play.
flavor: "But Saruman has long studied the arts of the Enemy himself, and thus we have often been able to forestall him." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: The Seeing-stone
text: Doomed 1. Action: Search your deck for a card with the Doomed keyword and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
flavor: "...alone it could do nothing but see small images of things far off and days remote." <cite>Gandalf, The Two Towers</cite>

name: Celeborn
text: Response: After a Silvan ally enters play, that ally gets +1 [willpower] +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round.
flavor: "...the lord of the Galadhrim is accounted wisest of the Elves of Middle-earth, and a giver of gifts beyond the power of kings." <cite>Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Naith Guide
text: Response: After Naith Guide enters play, choose a hero. That hero does not exhaust to quest this round.
flavor: "...I shall lead you well..." <cite>Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Swift and Silent
text: Action: Ready a hero you control. Then, if your threat is 20 or less and this is the first time you played a copy of Swift and Silent this round, return this card to your hand instead of discarding it.
flavor: A marching host of Elves had come up silently... <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Firefoot
text: Attach to a [tactics] or Rohan hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead if attached hero is Éomer). Response: After attached hero attacks alone, exhaust Firefoot to choose a non-unique enemy engaged with you. Excess damage dealt by this attack is assigned to the chosen enemy.

name: Close Call
text: Doomed X. Response: Cancel X damage just dealt to a hero.
flavor: "That spear-thrust would have skewered a wild boar!" <cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Blue Mountain Trader
text: Action: Choose another player. That player gains control of Blue Mountain Trader. Then, that player moves 1 resource from the resource pool of a hero he controls to the resource pool of a hero you control, or Blue Mountain Trader is discarded. (Limit once per round.)

name: The Fall of Gil-Galad
text: Limit 1 per deck. Attach to a hero. Response: When attached hero is destroyed, add The Fall of Gil-Galad to the victory display to reduce your threat by X, where X is the attached hero's threat cost.
flavor:
...for into darkness fell his star
in Mordor where the shadows are.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Ithilien Lookout
text: Secrecy 2. Response: After Ithilien Lookout enters play, look at the top card of the encounter deck. If it is an enemy, you may discard it.
flavor: All had swords at their sides... <cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: The Tree People
text: Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to search the top 5 cards of your deck for a Silvan ally. Put that ally into play and shuffle the other cards back into your deck. You can only play 1 copy of The Tree People each phase.
flavor: No folk could they see, nor hear any feet upon the paths; but there were many voices, about them, and in the air above. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: The White Council
text: X is the number of players in the game. Action: Starting with the first player, each player chooses 1 different option: ready a hero he controls, add 1 resource to the resource pool of a hero he controls, draw 1 card, or shuffle 1 card from his discard pile into his deck.
flavor:
"I it was who first summoned the White Council."
<cite>Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Idraen
text: Response: After a location is explored, ready Idraen.
flavor: "Where now are the Dúnedain, Elessar, Elessar? Why do thy kinsfolk wander afar?" <cite>Galadriel, The Two Towers</cite>

name: Rivendell Scout
text: Secrecy 2.
flavor: "Elrond is sending Elves, and they will get in touch with the Rangers, and maybe with Thranduil's folk in Mirkwood." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Feigned Voices
text: Combat Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to choose an enemy engaged with a player. That enemy cannot attack that player this phase.
flavor: "The three of us could not challenge a hundred, so we went ahead and spoke with feigned voices, leading them on into the wood." <cite>Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Rúmil
text: Ranged. Response: After you play Rúmil from your hand, choose an enemy engaged with a player. Deal X damage to that enemy where X is the number of ranged characters you control.
flavor: ...the Company set out again, guided now by Haldir and his brother Rúmil. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Elven Mail
text: Restricted. Attach to a Noldor or Silvan character. Attached character gets +2 hit points and gains sentinel.
flavor: ...they were tall and and clad in grey mail, and from their shoulders hung long white cloaks. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Greyflood Wanderer
text: You may give Greyflood Wanderer doomed 2 when you play from your hand. If you do, it gains: "Response: After you play Greyflood Wanderer, place 1 progress token on each location in play."
flavor: ...others had gone west, and with the help of Aragorn and the Rangers had searched the lands far down the Greyflood... <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Warden of Arnor
text: Attach to a Scout hero. While attached character is committed to the quest, place 1 progress on the first location revealed by the encounter deck each round.
flavor: "I have had a hard life and a long: and the leagues that lie between here and Gondor are a small part in the count of my journeys." <cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Message from Elrond
text: Action: Choose a player. That player may choose 1 card from his hand and add it to another player's hand. At the end of the round, if the chosen card is in that player's hand or in play, shuffle it into its owner's deck.
flavor: "But we have heard rumours of your coming, for the messengers of Elrond passed by Lórien on the way home up the Dimrill Stair. <cite>Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Noiseless Movement
text: Action: Choose an enemy in the staging area. That enemy does not make engagement checks this round. Then, if your threat is 20 or less and this is the first time you played a copy of Noiseless Movement this round, return this card to your hand instead of discarding it.
flavor: ...the woodland folk were altogether noiseless in their movements. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Leaf Brooch
text:
Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero.
The first event card you play each round that matches attached hero's printed sphere gains secrecy 1.
flavor: Each cloak was fastened about the neck with a brooch like a green leaf veined with silver. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Haldir of Lórien
text: Ranged. Combat Action: If you have not engaged an enemy this round, exhaust Haldir of Lórien to declare him as an attacker (and resolve his attack) against an enemy not engaged with you. Limit once per round.
flavor: "We allow no strangers to spy out the secrets of the Naith..." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Herald of Anórien
text: You may give Herald of Anórien doomed 2 when you play it from your hand. If you do, it gains: "Response: After you play Herald of Anórien, choose a player. That player may put into play 1 ally from his hand with a printed cost 2 or lower."
flavor: "Send the heralds forth! Let them summon all who dwell nigh!" <cite>Théoden, The Two Towers</cite>

name: O Lórien!
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Exhaust O Lórien! to lower the cost of the next Silvan ally played this phase by 1 (to a minimum of 1).
flavor:
"I sang of leaves, of leaves of gold, and
leaves of gold there grew:
Of wind I sang, a wind there came and in the
branches blew." <cite>Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Gwaihir
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Response: After Gwaihir enters play, search your discard pile for an Eagle ally and put it into play under your control. At the end of the round, if that ally is still in play, add it to your hand.
flavor: "The North Wind blows, but we shall outfly it." <cite>Gwaihir, The Return of the King</cite>

name: Pursuing the Enemy
text: Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to choose a player. Deal 1 damage to each enemy engaged with that player.
flavor: The marauding orcs had been waylaid and almost all destroyed; the remnant had fled westward towards the mountains, and were being pursued. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Courage Awakened
text: Action: Choose a hero. That hero gets +2 [willpower] until the end of the phase. Then, if your threat is 20 or less and this is the first time you played a copy of Courage Awakened this round, return this card to your hand instead of discarding it.
flavor: But the courage that had been awakened in him was now too strong: he could not leave his friends so easily. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Free to Choose
text: Response: After your threat is raised by an encounter card effect, reduce your threat by an equal amount.
flavor: Suddenly he was aware of himself again. Frodo, neither the Voice nor the Eye; free to choose, and with one remaining instant in which to do so. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Galadhrim Minstrel
text: Response: After Galadhrim Minstrel enters play, search the top five cards of your deck for an event card and add it to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
flavor: ...the language was that of Elven-song and spoke of things little known on Middle-earth. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Lembas
text: Play only if you control a Noldor or Silvan hero. Attach to a hero. Action: Discard Lembas to ready attached hero and heal 3 damage from it.
flavor: "...it is more strengthing than any food made by Men, and it is more pleasant than cram, by all accounts. <cite>Lórien Elf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Defender of the Naith
text: Sentinel. Response: After a Silvan ally you control leaves play, ready Defender of the Naith.
flavor: "We have been keeping watch on the rivers, ever since we saw a great troop of Orcs going North toward Moria..." <cite>Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Mablung
text: Response: After you engage an enemy, add 1 resource to Mablung's resource pool. (Limit once per phase.)
flavor:
But the Captains of the West were well warned by their scouts, skilled men from Henneth Annûn led by Mablung...
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Follow Me!
text: Action: Take control of the first player token and draw 1 card.
flavor:
"Come! I will lead you now!"
<cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Tighten Our Belts
text: Refresh Action: Choose a player. Each hero that player controls that did not spend any resources this round gains 1 resource. Only 1 copy of Tighten Our Belts can be played by the players each round.
flavor: There was nothing now to be done but to tighten the belts round their empty stomachs, and hoist their empty sacks and packs... <cite>The Hobbit</cite>

name: Galadhon Archer
text: Ranged. Response: After Galadhon Archer enters play, deal 1 damage to an enemy not engaged with you.
flavor: "...they say that you breathe so loud that they could shoot you in the dark." <cite>Legolas, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Bow of the Galadhrim
text: Restricted. Attach to a Silvan character with the ranged keyword. Attached character gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead if attacking an enemy not engaged with you.)
flavor: ...longer and stronger than the bows of Mirkwood, and strung with a string of elf-hair. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Celduin Traveler
text: Secrecy 2. Response: After Celduin Traveler enters play, look at the top card of the encounter deck. If it is a location, you may discard it.
flavor: In two days going they rowed right up the Long Lake and passed out into the River Running... <cite>The Hobbit</cite>

name: Island Amid Perils
text: Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to reduce your threat by X where X is the printed cost of the ally returned to your hand.
flavor:
"...we dare not by our own trust endanger our land. We live now upon an island amid many perils..." 
<cite>Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Mirkwood Pioneer
text: You may give Mirkwood Pioneer doomed 1 when you play it from your hand. If you do, it gains: "Response: After you play Mirkwood Pioneer, choose a card in the staging area. Until the end of the round, the chosen card does not contribute its [threat]."

name: Wingfoot
text: Attach to a Ranger hero. Response: After attached hero commits to a quest. name enemy, location or treachery. If a card of the named type is revealed during this quest phase, exhaust Wingfoot to ready attached hero.
flavor:
"Wingfoot I name you. This deed of the three friends should be sung in many a hall. Forty leagues and five you have measured ere the forth day is ended!"
<cite>Éomer, The Two Towers</cite>

name: Defender of the West
text:
Attach to a non-objective unique ally in play.
The first player gains control of attached ally.
Damage from undefended attacks against you may be assigned to attached ally.
flavor:
"...if by life or death I can save you, I will."
<cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Galadriel
text: Galadriel cannot quest, attack, or defend. Allies you control do not exhaust to commit to the quest during the round they enter play. Action: Exhaust Galadriel to choose a player. That player reduces his threat by 1 and draws 1 card. (Limit once per round.)

name: Heir of Mardil
text: Attach to a Noble hero. Response: After attached hero gains any number of resources from a card effect, exhaust Heir of Mardil to ready attached hero.
flavor:
"...in my turn I bore it, and so did each eldest son of our house, far back into the vanished years before the failing of the kings..."
<cite>Denethor, The Return of the King</cite>

name: Orophin
text: Ranged. Response: After Orophin enters play, return a Silvan ally from your discard pile to your hand.
flavor: "Orophin has now gone in haste back to our dwellings to warn our people." <cite>Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Henneth Annûn Guard
text: You may give Henneth Annûn Guard doomed 1 when you play it from your hand. If you do, it gains: "Response: After you play Henneth Annûn Guard, choose a character. Until the end of the round, that character gets +2 [defense] and gains sentinel."
flavor: "Does he think that men sleep without watch all night?" <cite>Faramir, The Two Towers</cite>

name: Charge of the Rohirrim
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, each Rohan character with a Mount attachment gets +3 [attack].
flavor: "Arise, arise, riders of Théoden!" <cite>Théoden, The Return of the King</cite>

name: Galadriel's Handmaiden
text: Response: After Galadriel's Handmaiden enters play, choose a player. That player reduces his threat by 1.
flavor: Her maidens stood silent about her, and a while she looked upon her guests. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Mirror of Galadriel
text:
Attach to Galadriel.
Exhaust Mirror of Galadriel to search the top 10 cards of your deck for a card and add it to your hand. Shuffle the rest back into your deck. Then, discard a random card from your hand.
flavor:
"What you will see, if you leave the Mirror free to work, I cannot tell. For it shows things that were, things that are, things that yet may be."
<cite>Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Wandering Ent
text:
Cannot have restricted attachments.
Enters play exhausted.
flavor: There were songs about the hunt of the Ents for the Entwives sung among Elves and Men from Mirkwood to Gondor. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: Cloak of Lórien
text: Attach to a Noldor or Silvan character. Limit 1 per character. Attached character gets +1 [defense] (+2 [defense] instead if the active location has the Forest trait).
flavor: It was hard to say what colour they were: grey with the hue of twilight under the trees they seemed to be; and yet if they were moved, or set in another light, they were green as shadowed leaves... <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Nenya
text: Attach to Galadriel. She gains a [lore] resource icon. Quest Action: Exhaust Nenya and Galadriel to add her [willpower] to another character's [willpower] until the end of the phase.
flavor: "The is Nenya, the Ring of Adamant, and I am its keeper." <cite>Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Erkenbrand
text: Sentinel. While Erkenbrand is defending, he gains: "Response: Deal 1 damage to Erkenbrand to cancel a shadow effect just triggered."
flavor: Down from the hills leaped Erkenbrand, lord of Westfold. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: Warden of Helm's Deep
text: Sentinel.
flavor: They now learned to their joy that Erkenbrand had left many men to hold Helm's Gate, and more had since escaped thither. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: The Day's Rising
text: Attach to a hero with sentinel. Response: After attached hero defends against an attack and takes no damage while defending that attack, exhaust The Day's Rising to add 1 resource to the attached hero's resource pool.
flavor:
Out of doubt, out of dark to the day's rising
I came singing in the sun, sword unsheathing.
<cite>Éomer, The Return of the King</cite>

name: Captain of Gondor
text: Attach to a Warrior hero. Response: After you optionally engage an enemy, exhaust Captain of Gondor to give attached hero +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round.
flavor: "Boromir it was that drove the enemy at last back from this western shore..." <cite>Beregond, The Return of the King</cite>

name: Booming Ent
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted. Booming Ent gets +1 [attack] for each damaged Ent character you control.
flavor: "...a man that hacks once at an Ent never gets a chance of a second blow." <cite>Merry, The Two Towers</cite>

name: Ride Them Down
text: Quest Action: Choose a non-unique enemy in the staging area. Until the end of the phase, progress that would be placed on the quest from questing successfully is instead assigned as damage to the chosen enemy. (Progress must still be placed on any active location first.)
flavor: Like thunder they broke upon the enemy... <cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Shadows Give Way
text: You must use resources from 3 different heroes' pools to pay for this card. Action: Discard each shadow card from each enemy in play.
flavor: At that moment he caught a flash of white and silver coming from the North, like a small star down on the dusky fields. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Don't Be Hasty!
text: Response: When an encounter card is revealed but before resolving any of that card's keywords or "when revealed" effects, choose a character committed to the quest. Ready that character and remove it from the quest.
flavor: "Don't be hasty, that is my motto." <cite>Treebeard, The Two Towers</cite>

name: Waters of Nimrodel
text: Doomed 3. Action: Heal all damage on each character in play.
flavor: For a moment Frodo stood near the brink and let the water flow over his tired feet. It was cold but its touch was clean, and as he went on and it mounted to his knees, he felt that the strain of travel and all weariness was washed from his limbs. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Treebeard
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Treebeard enters play exhausted and collects 1 resource each resource phase. These resources can be used to pay for Ent cards played from your hand. Action: Pay 2 resources from Treebeard's pool to ready an Ent character.

name: Aragorn
text: Each enemy engaged with you gets -1 [defense]. Response: After Aragorn participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, choose an enemy not engaged with you and engage that enemy.
flavor: "I serve no man," said Aragorn; "but the servants of Sauron I pursue into whatever land they may go." <cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: Halbarad
text:
While you are engaged with any enemy, Halbarad does not exhaust to commit to a quest.
You may optionally engage 1 additional enemy during the encounter phase.
flavor: "Little do they know of our long labour for the safekeeping of their borders, and yet I grudge it not." <cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Weather Hills Watchman
text: Response: After Weather Hills Watchman enters play, search the top 5 cards of your deck for a Signal card and add it to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
flavor: "Rangers use runes, and they come here sometimes." <cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Dúnedain Hunter
text: Forced: After Dúnedain Hunter enters play, search the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a non-unique enemy and put it into play engaged with you. If no enemy enters play by this effect, discard Dúnedain Hunter. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Sarn Ford Sentry
text: Response: After Sarn Ford Sentry enters play, draw 1 card for each enemy engaged with you.
flavor: "Lonely men are we, Rangers of the wild, hunters but hunters ever of the servants of the Enemy..." <cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Warden of Annúminas
text: Warden of Annúminas gets +1 [willpower] for each enemy engaged with you.
flavor: Rangers passed at times beyond the hills, but they were few and did not stay. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Ranger Summons
text: Play only if you control a Dúnedain hero. Planning Action: Shuffle 1 of your set aside Ranger of the North allies with the encounter keyword into the encounter deck. Then, remove Ranger Summons from the game.
flavor: "We rode as swiftly as we might when your summons came." <cite>Halbarad, The Return of the King</cite>

name: Tireless Hunters
text: Play only before the resolving enemy attacks step. Combat Action: Choose an enemy not engaged with you. Engage that enemy. Then, discard a shadow card from that enemy, if able.
flavor: "Many evil things there are that your strong walls and bright swords do not stay." <cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Expert Trackers
text: Response: After you engage an enemy, exhaust a Scout or Ranger character to place X progress tokens on a location. X is the engaged enemy's printed [threat].
flavor: "At last!" said Aragorn. "Here are the tracks that we seek!" <cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: Heir of Valandil
text: Attach to a Dúnedain hero. Planning Action: Exhaust Heir of Valandil to reduce the cost of the next Dúnedain ally you play this phase by 1 for each enemy engaged with you.
flavor: "But my home, such as I have, is in the North. For here the heirs of Valandil have ever dwelt in long line unbroken from father unto son for many generations." <cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Athelas
text: Attach to a Dúnedain or Healer character. Action: Discard Athelas and exhaust attached character to heal all damage on a character. You may discard a Condition attachment from that character.
flavor: "...it is a healing plant that the Men of the West brought to Middle-earth. Athelas they named it..." <cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Secret Vigil
text: Attach to an enemy. Limit 1 per enemy. Attached enemy gets -1 [threat]. Response: When attached enemy is destroyed, reduce each player's threat by the attached enemy's printed [threat].
flavor: "If simple folk are free from care and fear, simple they will be, and we must be secret to keep them so." <cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Star Brooch
text: Attach to a Dúnedain or Noldor hero. Limit 1 per hero. While you are engaged with an enemy, attached hero gets +1 [willpower] and cannot have its [willpower] reduced.
flavor: ...each cloak was pinned upon the left shoulder by a brooch of silver shaped like a rayed star. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Gather Information
text: Limit 1 per deck. Response: After this stage is defeated, each player may search his deck for 1 card and add it to his hand. Each player shuffles his deck.
flavor: Aragorn halted and examined the tracks closely. <cite>The Tower Towers</cite>

name: Ranger of the North
text: Encounter. Surge. Ranged. Sentinel. When Revealed: The first player chooses a player to take control of Ranger of the North. Then, either deal 2 damage to an enemy or place 2 progress tokens on a location.

name: Merry
text: Response: After an enemy is revealed from the top of the encounter deck, exhaust Merry to reduce your threat by that enemy's [threat].
flavor:
"We have come a long way with you and been through some stiff times. We want to go on."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Ingold
text: Ingold gets +1 [willpower] for each hero you control with at least 1 resource in its resource pool.
flavor:
"We wish for no strangers in the land at this time, unless they be mighty men of arms in whose faith and help we can trust."
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Rallying Cry
text: Response: After an ally leaves play, add it to its owner's hand instead of placing it in the discard pile. Valour Action: Until the end of the phase, add each ally that leaves play to its owner's hand instead of placing it in the discard pile.
flavor:
He let blow the horns to rally all men to his banner that could come thither...
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Honour Guard
text: Response: Exhaust Honour Guard to cancel the first point of damage just dealt to a character. Valour Response: Exhaust and discard Honour Guard to cancel up to 5 damage just dealt to a character.

name: Raven-winged Helm
text: Attach a hero with Sentinel. Limit 1 per hero. Response: Exhaust Raven-winged Helm to prevent 1 point of damage just dealt to attached character.
flavor:
He had a small hauberk, its rings of forged of steel, maybe, yet black as jet; and a high-crowned helm with small raven-wings on either side, set with a silver star in the centre of the circlet.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Curious Brandybuck
text: Forced: After the active location is explored, place Curious Brandybuck on the bottom of its owner's deck. Response: After you travel to a location, put Curious Brandybuck into play from your hand, under any player's control.

name: Hobbit Pony
text: Attach to a Hobbit hero. Restricted. Quest Action: If attached hero is not committed to the quest, exhaust Hobbit Pony and attached hero to commit attached hero to the quest.
flavor:
He was riding a pony, and a scarf was swathed round his neck and over his chin to keep out the fog.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: East Road Ranger
text: East Road Ranger gets +2 [willpower] while committed to a side quest.
flavor:
"If you bring a Ranger with you, it is well to pay attention to him..."
<cite>Gandalf, the Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Scout Ahead
text: Limit 1 per deck. Response: When this stage is defeated, the first player searches the top X cards of the encounter deck for 1 non-objective card worth no victory points and adds it to the victory display. Put the remaining cards back in any order. X is the number of players in the game plus 4.
flavor: Strider made them take cover in a thicket at the side of the Road, while he went forward to explore. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Ranger of Cardolan
text: Response: After you engage an enemy, if you control at least 1 Dúnedain hero, spend 1 resource to put Ranger of Cardolan into play from your hand, under your control. At the end of the round, if Ranger of Cardolan is still in play, shuffle it into its owner's deck.

name: Rossiel
text: If the active location shares a Trait with a location in the victory display, Rossiel gets +2 [willpower]. If the attacking enemy shares a Trait with an enemy in the victory display, Rossiel gets +2 [defense].
flavor:
"Did you not say that you wished to see Elf-magic?"
<cite>Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Veteran of Osgiliath
text: Veteran of Osgiliath gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], and +1 [defense] while your threat is 40 or higher.
flavor:
"So do we ever watch the shores nigh Osgiliath, which our enemies now partly hold, and issue from it to harry our lands."
<cite>Faramir, The Two Towers</cite>

name: Descendants of Kings
text: Ready up to X Dúnedain characters you control. X is the number of enemies engaged with you.
flavor:
"But when dark things come from the houseless hills, or creep from sunless woods, they fly from us."
<cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Derndingle Warrior
text: Sentinel. Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted. While Derndingle Warrior is defending, it gains: "Action: Deal 1 damage to Derndingle Warrior to give it +3 [defense] for this attack." (Limit once per attack.)

name: Boomed and Trumpeted
text: Response: After an Ent character takes any amount of damage, ready it. That character gets +3 [attack] until the end of the phase.
flavor: "They roared and boomed and trumpeted, until stones began to crack and fall at the mere noise of them." <cite>Merry, The Two Towers</cite>

name: Elven Jeweler
text: Action: Discard 2 cards from your hand to put Elven Jeweler into play from your hand, under your control.
flavor: "...to the Elven-smiths they were but trifles..." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Double Back
text: Limit 1 per deck. Response: When this stage is defeated, reduce each player's threat by 5.
flavor: He was taking a wandering course with many turns and doublings, to put off any pursuit. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Leave No Trace
text: Limit 3 copies of Leave No Trace in the victory display. Response: After a non-unique location is explored, add Leave No Trace to the victory display to add that location to the victory display.

name: Distant Stars
text: Action: Exhaust a Ranger or Scout character to discard a non-unique active location. Then, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a non-unique location and make it the active location. Shuffle the encounter deck.
flavor:
"I have crossed many mountains and many rivers, and trodden many plains, even into the far countries of Rhûn and Harad where the stars are strange..."
<cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Keen as Lances
text: Reduce the cost to play Keen as Lances by 1 for each card worth no victory points in the victory display. Action: Add Keen as Lances to the victory display. Then, choose one: add 2 resources to a hero's resource pool, draw 3 cards, or reduce your threat by 4.

name: Dori
text: Sentinel. Response: After another hero is declared as a defender, exhaust Dori to add his [defense] to the defending hero's [defense] for this attack.
flavor:
Dori was really a decent fellow in spite of his grumbling.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>

name: Ranger Provisions
text: Attach to a location. Limit 1 per location. Response: After attached location is explored, the first player adds 1 resource to each of his heroes' resource pools.
flavor:
"Rangers have been here lately. It is they who left the firewood behind."
<cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Dúnedain Message
text: Action: Search your deck for a side quest and add it to your hand. Suffle your deck.
flavor:
"I called for the help of the Dúnedain, and their watch has doubled..."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Longbeard Sentry
text: Action: Discard 2 cards from the top of your deck to give Longbeard Sentry sentinel and +1 [defense] until the end of the phase. (Limit once per phase.)
flavor:
"...many of them have had experience in the dreadful dwarf and goblin wars, of which you have no doubt heard."
<cite>Bilbo Baggins, The Hobbit</cite>

name: Delay the Enemy
text: Battle. Limit 1 per deck. Response: When this stage is defeated, each player may choose and discard a non-unique enemy engaged with him.

name: Steed of Imladris
text: Attach to a [spirit] or Noldor hero. Restricted. Response: After attached hero commits to a quest, discard a card from your hand to place 2 progress on the active location.
flavor:
In the dusk its headstall flickered and flashed, as if it were studded with gems like living stars.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Fair and Perilous
text: Action: Choose a Noldor or Silvan character. Until the end of the phase, add that character's [willpower] to its [attack].
flavor:
"...you saw him for a moment as he is upon the other side: one of the mighty of the Firstborn."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Wellinghall Preserver
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted. Response: After Wellinghall Preserver readies, heal 1 damage from an Ent character.

name: None Return
text: Limit 3 copies of None Return in the victory display. Response: After a non-unique enemy is destroyed, add None Return to the victory display to add that enemy to the victory display.
flavor:
"None of the Orcs will ever return out of Lórien."
<cite>Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Hope Rekindled
text: Action: Reduce the cost of the next event that has a Valour trigger you play this phase by 2. Valour Action: Search the top 10 cards of your deck for an event that has a Valour trigger and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
flavor:
Hope he rekindled, and in hope ended;
over death, over dread, over doom lifted
out of loss, out of life, unto long glory.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Erestor
text:
Draw 3 additional cards at the beginning of the resource phase.
At the end of the round, discard all cards in your hand.
flavor:
"That is the path of despair. Of folly, I would say, if the long wisdom of Elrond did not forbid me."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Reinforcements
text: You must spend resources from 3 different heroes' resource pools to play this card. Action: The players, as a group, can put up to 2 allies into play from their hands. Each of these allies may enter play under any player's control. At the end of the phase, return each of those allies that are still in play to their owners' hands.

name: Send for Aid
text: Limit 1 per deck. Response: When this stage is defeated, each player may search the top 10 cards of his deck for an ally and put it into play under his control. Each player who did shuffles his deck.
flavor:
"Often the Rohirrim have aided us, but now the Lord Denethor asks for all your strength and all your speed..."
<cite>Hirgon, The Return of the King</cite>

name: Elven Spear
text: Attach to a Noldor or Silvan hero. Restricted. Action: Discard a card from your hand to give attached hero +1 [attack] until the end of the phase. Limit 3 times per phase.
flavor:
Their spears and swords shone in the gloom with a gleam of chill flame, so deadly was the wrath of the hands that held them.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>

name: Horn's Cry
text: Action: All enemies get -1 [attack] until the end of the phase. Valour Action: Choose a player. Each enemy engaged with that player gets -3 [attack] until the end of the phase.
flavor:
Loud the challenge rang and bellowed, like the shout of many throats under the cavernous roof.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Galadhrim Weaver
text: Cannot attack or defend. Response: After Galadhrim Weaver enters play, shuffle the top card of your discard pile into your deck.
flavor: "You are indeed high in the favour of the Lady! For she herself and her maidens wove this..." <cite>Lórien Elf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Silver Harp
text: Restricted. Attach to a [spirit] hero. Response: After a card is discarded from your hand, exhaust Silver Harp to return that card to your hand.
flavor: Elrond wore a mantle of grey and had a star upon his forehead, and a silver harp was in his hand... <cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Galdor of the Havens
text: Response: After 1 or more cards are discarded from your hand, draw 1 card. Limit once per round.
flavor:
"But have they the strength, have we here the strength to withstand the Enemy, the coming of Sauron at the last, when all else is overthrown?"
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: The Door is Closed!
text: Response: After an encounter card is revealed from the encounter deck, cancel its effects and discard it if there is a card with the same title in the victory display.
flavor:
"...I perceive the Dark Lord and know his mind, or all of his mind that concerns the Elves. And he gropes ever to see me and my thought. But still the door is closed!"
<cite>Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Elf-friend
text: Attach to a character. Attached character gains the Noldor and Silvan traits.
flavor:
"I name you Elf-friend; and may the stars shine upon the end of your road!"
<cite>Gildor, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Amarthiúl
text:
While you are engaged with at least 1 enemy, Amarthiúl gains the [tactics] resource icon.
While you are engaged with at least 2 enemies, add 1 additional resource to Amarthiúl's resource pool when you collect resources during the resource phase.
flavor:
"The heirs of Elendil do not forget all things past..."
<cite>Aragorn, The Return of the King</cite>

name: Guardian of Arnor
text:
Sentinel.
Guardian of Arnor gets +1 [defense] for each enemy engaged with you.
flavor:
"Travellers scowl at us, and countrymen give us scornful names."
<cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Doom Hangs Still
text: Planning Action: Until the end of the round, players do not raise their threat from questing unsuccessfully. Valour Planning Action: Raise each player's threat by 2 to skip the quest phase this round.
flavor:
"Dooms hangs still on a thread. Yet hope there is still, if we can stand but unconquered for a little while."
<cite>Gandalf, The Two Towers</cite>

name: Beechbone
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted. Response: After Beechbone is declared as an attacker, deal 1 damage to him to deal X damage to the defending enemy. X is the amount of damage on Beechbone.

name: Hold Your Ground!
text: Action: Choose and ready a sentinel character. Valour Action: Ready all sentinel characters.
flavor:
Aragorn and Boromir did not heed the command, but still held their ground, side by side, behind Gandalf at the far end of the bridge.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Lindir
text: Response: After Lindir enters play, if you have less than 3 cards in your hand, draw until you have 3 cards in your hand.
flavor:
"To sheep other sheep no doubt appear different," laughed Lindir. "Or to shepherds. But Mortals have not been our study. We have other business."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Lords of the Eldar
text: Lords of the Eldar can only be played from your discard pile. Action: Place Lords of the Eldar on the bottom of your deck from your discard pile. Then, until the end of the round all Noldor characters get +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], and +1 [defense].

name: The Long Defeat
text: Attach to a quest card in play. Limit 1 per quest. Response: After attached quest card is defeated, each player either draws 2 cards or heals up to 5 damage from among characters he controls.
flavor:
"...for ere the fall of Nargothrond or Gondolin I passed over the mountains, and together through ages of the world we have fought the long defeat."
<cite>Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Quick Ears
text: Response: Exhaust a Dúnedain or Ranger hero to cancel an enemy card just revealed from the encounter deck. Then, shuffle it back into the encounter deck and reveal an additional encounter card.
flavor:
"... though I cannot disappear, I have hunted many wild and wary things and I can usually avoid being seen, if I wish."
<cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Favor of the Valar
text: Attach to a player's threat dial. Limit 1 per player. Forced: When you would be eliminated by reaching your threat elimination level, instead discard Favor of the Valar and reduce your threat to 5 less than your threat elimination level. You are not eliminated.
flavor:
"...their hearts were lifted up in such a hope as they had not known since the darkness came out of the East..."
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Arwen Undómiel
text: Action: Discard a card from your hand to add 1 resource to a Noldor's resource pool, or to Aragorn's resource pool. (Limit once per round.)
flavor:
...the light of stars was in her bright eyes, grey as a cloudless night; yet queenly she looked, and thought and knowledge were in her glance, as of one who has known many things that the years bring.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Éothain
text: Response: After a Rohan ally is discarded from play by a card effect, ready Éothain.
flavor:
"We must hasten south, lord. Let us leave these wild folk to their fancies. Or let us bind them and take them to our king."
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: Sword of Númenor
text: Attach to a Dúnedain or Gondor hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +1 [attack]. Response: After attached hero participates in an attack that destroys an enemy with 5 or more printed hit points, exhaust Sword of Númenor to add 1 resource to attached hero's resource pool.
flavor:
...the flowing characters of Númenor glinted like fire upon the blade.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Fornost Bowman
text:
Ranged.
Fornost Bowman gets +1 [attack] for each enemy engaged with you.
flavor:
To the last battle at Fornost with the Witch-lord of Angmar they sent some bowmen to the aid of the king...
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Hour of Wrath
text: Action: Choose a hero. Until the end of the phase, the chosen hero does not exhaust to attack or defend. Valour Action: Choose a player. Until the end of the phase, each of that player's heroes do not exhaust to attack or defend.
flavor:
These three were unscathed, for such was their fortune and the skill and might of their arms...
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Elven-light
text: Elven-light can only be played from your discard pile. Action: Return Elven-light to your hand from your discard pile. Then, draw 1 card.
flavor:
Then Aragorn was abashed, for he saw the elven-light in her eyes and the wisdom of many days...
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Tale of Tinúviel
text: Action: Exhaust a Noldor character to ready a Dúnedain character, or vice-versa. Until the end of the phase, add the exhausted character's printed [willpower] to the other character's [willpower], [attack] and [defense].
flavor:
Long was the way that fate them bore,
O'er stony mountains cold and grey,
Through halls of iron and darkling door,
And woods of nightshade morrowless.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Galadhrim Healer
text: Response: After Galadhrim Healer enters play, choose a player. Heal 1 damage from each hero controlled by that player.
flavor:
"Even if your Quest did not concern us closely, you should have refuge in this City, until you were healed and refreshed."
<cite>Celeborn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Weather-stained Cloak
text: Attach to a Ranger character. Limit 1 per character. While attached character is commited to the quest, Weather-stained Cloak gains: "Response: Exhaust Weather-stained Cloak to cancel 1 point of damage just dealt to attached character."
flavor:
They were clad in warm raiment and heavy cloaks...
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Sword-thain
text:
Attach to a unique ally belonging to any sphere of influence.
Attached character loses the ally card type and gains the hero card type.
flavor:
"But why, lord, did you receive me as sword-thain, if not to stay by your side?"
<cite>Merry, The Return of the King</cite>

name: Iârion's Pendant
text: Attached character gets +1 [willpower]. Response: Add Iârion’s Pendant to the victory display to cancel the ‘when revealed’ effects of a card that was just revealed from the encounter deck, or to cancel a shadow effect just triggered.
flavor:
“That is just what the Rangers are: the last remnant in the North of the great people.”
—Gandalf, The Lord of the Rings

name: Protect the Innocent
text: Side A Forced: After an attack damages a character, place 1 damage on Protect the Innocent. When progress would be placed on Protect the Innocent, remove that much damage from it instead. If Protect the Innocent has 10 or more damage on it (20 or more damage if there are 3 or 4 players in the game), the players lose the game. Side B Setup: Add Arnor Ravaged to the staging area with damage on it equal to the amount of damage marked for it in the Campaign Log. Forced: After an attack damages a character but does not destroy it, move 1 damage from Arnor Ravaged to that character.

name: Mysterious Omens
text: Surge. Forced: After Mysterious Omens becomes the current quest, each player discards 1 random card from their hand. Forced: When Mysterious Omens is defeated, remove it from the Campaign Pool. Then, each player may choose 1 of the following boons and attach it to a hero they control: Cunning, Hardy, Resolute, Ruthless, or Stalwart.

name: Cunning
text: Permanent. Setup: Attach to a hero. Add 2 resources to that hero’s resource pool. Action: Attached hero gets +2 [willpower], +2 [attack], and +2 [defense] until the end of the phase. (Limit once per game.)

name: Hardy
text: Permanent. Setup: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gets +2 hit points. Action: Ready attached hero. (Limit once per game.)

name: Resolute
text: Permanent. Setup: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gets +1 [willpower]. Response: Cancel up to 2 points of damage just dealt to attached hero. (Limit once per game.)

name: Ruthless
text: Permanent. Setup: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gets +1 [attack]. Action: Move any amount of damage from attached hero to an enemy engaged with you. (Limit once per game.)

name: Stalwart
text: Permanent. Setup: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gets +1 [defense]. Planning Action: Play an attachment from your discard pile on attached hero. (Limit once per game.)

name: Amarthiúl's Courage
text: Setup: Attach to Amarthiúl. Otherwise, remove Amarthiúl’s Courage from the game. Amarthiúl gets +1 [willpower] and +1 hit point. Action: Ready Amarthiúl. (Limit once per game.)

name: Thaurdir's Legacy
text: Setup: Attach to Thaurdir (even if he is out of play). Otherwise, remove this card from the game. Forced: After a Sorcery treachery is revealed, move Thaurdir’s Legacy to the hero with the most resources. (Counts as a Sorcery attachment with the text: “Attached hero gets –2 [willpower] and is treated as if its printed text box were blank.”)

name: Thaurdir's Majesty
text: Setup: Attach to Thaurdir (even if he is out of play). Otherwise, remove this card from the game. Forced: After a Sorcery treachery is revealed, move Thaurdir’s Majesty to the hero with the most non-objective attachments. (Counts as a Sorcery attachment with the text: “Attached hero gets –2 [attack] and cannot commit to the quest.”)

name: Thaurdir's Spite
text: Setup: Attach to Thaurdir (even if he is out of play). Otherwise, remove this card from the game. Forced: After a Sorcery treachery is revealed, move Thaurdir’s Spite to the hero with the most damage. (Counts as a Sorcery attachment with the text: “Attached hero gets –2 [defense] and cannot be healed.”)

name: Determination
text: Action: Attach Determination to a unique character. Then, ready each character with a copy of Determination attached, as well as each character who is “determined” in the Campaign Log. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Forced: If you win this scenario, mark in the Campaign Log that attached character is ‘determined.’”)

name: Fend off Despair
text: Each event card gains doomed 1. Forced: When Fend Off Despair is defeated, mark in the Campaign Log that each player’s starting threat is reduced by 2. (This reduction is cumulative.)
flavor: The loss of Iârion at the hands of the wraith weighs upon you and your companions, sapping your resolve and making you question every decision you make in your pursuit. Yet if you give in, there will surely be no rescue for him from the foul sorcery of Angmar...

name: Loot the Dungeons
text: Loot the Dungeons is considered to be in each player’s staging area and gets +4 quest points for each player in the game at every staging area. Forced: When Loot the Dungeons is defeated, each player (at every staging area) may choose one of the following boons and add it to their hand: Berelind, Chieftain’s Brooch, Coruhaer, Laermuin, Mail of Eärnur, or Silverthorn. Add the chosen cards to the Campaign Pool.

name: Berelind
text: Response: After Berelind attacks and destroys an enemy, place 1 progress on a quest card in play.
flavor:
A light fell about her, and her hair shone in the sunrise.
—The Lord of the Rings

name: Chieftain's Brooch
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Each ally that shares a Trait with attached hero gets +1 [willpower].
flavor:
When the kingdom ended the Dúnedain passed into the shadows and became a secret and wandering people, and their deeds and labours were seldom sung or recorded.
—The Lord of the Rings

name: Coruhaer
text: Response: After Coruhaer defends an attack, spend 1 resource to deal 2 damage to the attacking enemy.
flavor:
A dread fell on them, even as they passed between the lines of ancient stones.
—The Lord of the Rings

name: Laermuin
text: Response: After Laermuin commits to a quest, heal 1 damage from a character.
flavor:
Ancient of days he seemed and yet in the flower of manhood; and wisdom sat upon his brow.
—The Lord of the Rings

name: Mail of Eärnur
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +2 hit points. Response: After a player’s threat is reduced, heal 1 damage from attached hero.
flavor:
So ended the evil realm of Angmar; and so Eärnur, Captain of Gondor, earned the chief hatred of the Witch-King.
—The Lord of the Rings

name: Silverthorn
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. While attacking or defending against an enemy, attached hero gets +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] if that enemy shares a Trait with an enemy in the victory display. Response: After attached hero attacks and destroys an enemy, add that enemy to the victory display. (Limit once per game.)

name: Losing Time
text: Surge. When Revealed: Each player must either raise their threat by 3 or exhaust a hero they control. Shadow: Attacking enemy either gets +3 [attack] or +3 [defense] until the end of the phase.

name: Daechanar's Brand
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead when attacking an Undead enemy). Response: After you play Daechnar’s Brand, search the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a Sorcery treachery and add it to the victory display. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Heirloom of Iârchon
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +1 [willpower]. Response: After you play Heirloom of Iârchon, heal all damage from attached character.
flavor:
“Iârchon, may this pendant guide you away from the shadow that dwells within us all.”
—Pendant Inscription

name: Orders from Angmar
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +1 [defense] (+2 [defense] instead while defending against an Undead enemy). Response: After you play Orders from Angmar, discard a non-unique Undead enemy with 2 or less remaining hit points.

name: Elrond's Champion
text: Response: After an enemy engages you, ready Elrond’s Champion.
flavor:
"That is a chapter of ancient history which it might be good to recall; for there was sorrow then too, and gathering dark, but great valour, and great deeds that were not wholly vain."
—Gandalf, The Lord of the Rings

name: Lore of Ancient Arnor
text: Action: Each player returns 1 card from their discard pile to their hand (2 cards instead if you are the only player in the game) and shuffles the rest of their discard pile back into their deck. Then, remove this card from the game.

name: Raiment of the Second Age
text: Attach to a character. Restricted. Attached character gets +2 [attack] and +2 hit points. Response: After attached character attacks and destroys an enemy, draw 1 card.
flavor:
"It recalled to me the glory of the Elder Days and the hosts of Beleriand."
—Elrond, The Lord of the Rings

name: Rivendell Skirmishers
text: Response: After Rivendell Skirmishers exhausts to defend an attack from non-unique enemy, discard each shadow card from that enemy.
flavor:
It was said that Angmar was for a time subdued by the Elvenfolk coming from Lindon and from Rivendell.
—The Lord of the Rings

name: Círdan the Shipwright
text: Draw 1 additional card at the beginning of the resource phase. Forced: After drawing cards at the beginning of the resource phase, choose and discard 1 of those cards.
flavor:
Very tall he was, and his beard was long, and he was grey and old, save that his eyes were keen as stars...
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Galdor of the Havens
text: Response: After drawing your setup hand, instead of taking a mulligan, you may discard any number of cards from your hand. Then, draw that many cards. Action: If you have no cards in your hand, draw 6 cards. (Limit once per game.)
flavor:
"What power still remains lies with us..."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Mithlond Sea-watcher
text: While the top card of your discard pile is an ally, Mithlond Sea-watcher gets +2 [attack] and gains ranged.
flavor:
But it was an old tradition that away over there stood the Grey Havens, from which at times elven-ships set sail, never to return.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Skyward Volley
text: As an additional cost to play Skyward Volley, exhaust a ranged character you control. Combat Action: Deal 2 damage to an enemy engaged with a player. Resolve that effect again for each copy of Skyward Volley currently in your discard pile (you may choose different targets).

name: Grappling Hook
text: Attach to a character. Quest Action: Discard Grappling Hook and exhaust attached character to commit attached character to the quest, using its [attack] instead of its [willpower] (or instead of its [defense] if the current quest has the siege keyword).

name: Warden of the Havens
text: While the top card of your discard pile is an attachment, Warden of the Havens gets +2 [defense] and gains sentinel.
flavor:
"...and if he comes, assailing the White Towers and the Havens, hereafter the Elves may have no escape from the lengthening shadows of Middle-earth."
<cite>Galdor, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Anchor Watch
text: Response: After an enemy is declared as an attacker against you, declare an exhausted character you control as the defender. Resolve that effect again for each copy of Anchor Watch currently in your discard pile (all chosen characters are defending against this attack).

name: Mariner's Compass
text: Attach to a [leadership] or a Scout character. Response: At the beginning of the travel phase, exhaust Mariner's Compass and attached character to search the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a location. Switch that location with a location in the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Lindon Navigator
text: Lindon Navigator does not exhaust to commit to a quest, and can commit to quests while exhausted. Forced: After resolving a quest to which Lindon Navigator was committed, either discard it from play or discard 1 card from your hand.

name: The Evening Star
text: Action: Place 2 progress on any location. Resolve that effect again for each copy of The Evening Star currently in your discard pile (you may choose new targets).
flavor:
...for ever still a herald on
an errand that should never rest
to bear his shining lamp afar,
the Flammifer of Westernesse.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Explorer's Almanac
text:
Attach to a location in the staging area.
Progress from questing successfully may be placed on the attached location before it is placed on the current quest.

name: Sailor of Lune
text: While the top card of your discard pile is an event, Sailor of Lune gets +1 [willpower] and gains: "Cannot be damaged while committed to the quest."
flavor:
"They are sailing, sailing, sailing over the Sea, they are going into the West and leaving us," said Sam, half chanting the words, shaking his head sadly and solemnly.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Elwing's Flight
text: Quest Action: Ready a questing character and give that character +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase. Resolve that effect again for each copy of Elwing's Flight currently in your discard pile (you may choose different targets).
flavor:
There flying Elwing came to him
and flame was in the darkness lit;
more bright than light of diamond
the fire upon her carcanet.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: To the Sea, to the Sea!
text: Attach to a Noldor character. Action: Exhaust To the Sea, to the Sea! and discard X cards from your hand to reduce the cost of the next Noldor ally played this phase by X (to a minimum of 1).
flavor:
To the Sea, to the Sea! The white gulls are crying,
The wind is blowing, and the white foam is flying.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Narya
text: Attach to Círdan the Shipwright or Gandalf. Attached character gains a [leadership] resource icon. Action: Exhaust Narya and attached character to choose and ready up to 2 allies. Each of those allies gets +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the phase.
flavor:
"For this is the Ring of Fire, and with it you may rekindle hearts in a world that grows chill."
<cite>Círdan, The Return of the King</cite>

name: Denethor
text: Setup: Add 2 resources to Denethor's resource pool. Action: Move 1 resource from Denethor's resource pool to another Gondor hero's resource pool. (Limit once per round.)
flavor: "...why should I sit here in my tower and think, and watch, and wait, spending even my sons? For I can still wield a brand." <cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Rod of the Steward
text: Attach to a Gondor hero. Action: Spend 2 resources from attached hero's resource pool to draw 1 card.
flavor:
"The last Steward of Gondor begs leave to surrender his office." And he held out a white rod.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: In Service of the Steward
text: Attach to a character. Attached character gains the Gondor trait.
flavor:
But be it known that I have now sworn him to my service...
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Azain Silverbeard
text: Response: After Azain Silverbeard participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, spend 1 [tactics] resource to deal 2 damage to another enemy that shares a Trait with the destroyed enemy. Any player may trigger this response.

name: Last Stand
text: Response: After a Warrior character is destroyed while defending against an enemy attack, deal damage to the attacking enemy equal to that character's printed [attack].
flavor:
In a grave alone under the shadow of the Hornburg lay Háma, captain of the King's guard. He fell before the Gate.
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: Glorfindel
text: Glorfindel can be played from your discard pile. Action: Discard a card from your hand to ready Glorfindel. (Limit once per phase.)
flavor:
"He is an Elf-lord of a house of princes."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Tides of Fate
text: Response: When a shadow card increases an enemy's [attack] by any amount, increase the defending character's [defense] by 3 for that attack. Then, the players as a group may spend 2 [tactics] resources to ready the defending character and give it +3 [attack] for its next attack this phase.
flavor:
...the tides of fate hd turned against them and their doom was at hand.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Imladris Caregiver
text: Action: Discard a card from your hand to heal 1 damage on any character. (Limit twice per round).
flavor:
"You are in Rivendell, and you need not worry about anything for the present."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Heed the Dream
text: Action: Choose a player. That player searches the top 5 cards of his deck for a card, adds it to his hand, and shuffles his deck. Then, the players as a group may spend 3 [leadership] resources to have that player search his deck for another card, add it to his hand, and shuffle his deck.

name: Guardian of Rivendell
text: As an additional cost to play Guardian of Rivendell from your hand, you must discard 2 cards from your hand.
flavor:
"Indeed there is a power in Rivendell to withstand the might of Mordor, for a while."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Vanish from Sight
text: Play only if you control 2 or fewer heroes. Action: Until the end of the phase, if your threat is higher than 20, treat your threat as if it is 20.
flavor:
"I see now little hope, if we do not soon vanish from sight for a while, and cover our trail."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Lanwyn
text: Ranged. Response: After an encounter card with surge is revealed, either ready Lanwyn or give her +2 [willpower] until the end of the phase. (Limit twice per phase.)
flavor: "The Men of Dale used to have the trick of understanding their language, and used them for messengers to fly to the Men of the Lake..." <cite>Thorin, The Hobbit</cite>

name: Eldahir
text: Sentinel. Action: Spend 1 [lore] resource to look at a facedown shadow card dealt to an engaged enemy. If that card has a shadow effect, Eldahir gets +2 [defense] until the end of the phase. Any player may trigger this action. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Captain's Wisdom
text: Resource Action: Exhaust a Noble hero you control to add 2 resources to that hero's resource pool.
flavor:
...in these days men are slow to believe that a captain can be wise and learned in the scrolls of lore and song, as he is, and yet man of hardihood and swift judgement in the field.
<cite>Beregond, The Return of the King</cite>

name: Master Ironsmith
text: Response: After you play Master Ironsmith from your hand, if you paid all of its resource cost from a single hero's resource pool, attach a Weapon or Armor attachment from your hand or discard pile to that hero without paying its resource cost.

name: Raiment of War
text: Attach to a Warrior character. Raiment of War counts as 2 Restricted attachments. Attached character gets +1 [attack], +1 [defense] and +2 hit points.
flavor:
Now men came bearing raiment of war from the king's hoard...
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: Sam Gamgee
text: Reduce the cost to play Sam Gamgee by 2 if you control Frodo Baggins. Response: After a player raises his threat, that player may spend 1 [spirit] resource to ready Sam Gamgee. He gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)

name: Elevenses
text: Play only after the staging step. Quest Action: Choose X questing Hobbit characters you control. Ready each chosen character and remove them from the quest. Then, reduce your threat by X.
flavor:
"The road goes on for ever," said Pippin; "but I can't without a rest. It is high time for lunch."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Mirkwood Explorer
text: Response: After Mirkwood Explorer quests successfully, place 1 progress on it. Action: Exhaust Mirkwood Explorer to move all progress from it to a location in play.

name: Guarded Ceaselessly
text: Attach to a location. Action: Exhaust a Ranger or Scout character to give attached location -2 [threat] until the end of the phase.
flavor:
"In this high play you may see the two powers that are opposed to one another; and ever they strive now in thought..."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Elfhelm
text: Each [spirit] hero with an attached Mount gets +1 [willpower]. Each [tactics] hero with an attached Mount gets +1 [attack]. Each [leadership] hero with an attached Mount gets +1 [defense].
flavor: Ahead nearer the walls Elfhelm's men were among the siege-engines, hewing, slaying, driving their foes into the fire-pits. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Ceorl
text: Spend 1 [spirit] resource to ready Ceorl. Then, you may give control of Ceorl to another player. Any player may trigger this action. (Limit once per phase).
flavor:
He drew himself up. Then he knelt, offering his notched sword to the king. "Command me, lord!" he cried. 
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: Armored Destrier
text: Attach to a [leadership] or sentinel hero. Restricted. Response: After attached hero defends against an attack, exhaust Armored Destrier to ready attached hero. Then, discard a shadow card from another enemy engaged with the defending player.

name: Déorwine
text: Sentinel. Action: While Déorwine is defending, spend 1 [leadership] resource to cancel a shadow effect dealt to the attacking enemy. Any player may trigger this action.

name: Revealed in Wrath
text: Play only if you control a Noldor hero. Action: Choose a non-unique enemy. Until the end of the phase, treat the chosen enemy's printed text box as if it were blank (except for Traits).
flavor: "…seeing an Elf-lord revealed in his wrath, they were dismayed, and their horses were stricken with madness." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Rhovanion Outrider
text: Response: After Rhovanion Outrider commits to the quest, place 1 progress on a location in the staging area. If that location is not explored by this effect, give Rhovanion Outrider +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

name: Scouting Party
text: Response: After you commit characters to the quest, if each character you have committed to the quest is a Scout, each of those characters gets +2 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

name: Entangling Nets
text:
Play Entangling Nets into the staging area unattached.
If unattached, attach Entangling Nets to the next eligible enemy that enters the staging area.
Attached enemy gets –2 [attack] and –2 [defense].

name: Arrows from the Trees
text: Play only after making engagement checks. Encounter Action: If no enemies were engaged this phase, deal 1 damage to each enemy in the staging area. Then, the players as a group may spend 3 [tactics] resources to deal 2 additional damage to each enemy in the staging area.

name: Ered Luin Miner
text: Response: After Ered Luin Miner is discarded from your deck, put it into play under your control.
flavor:
Tools were to be found in plenty that the miners and quarriers and builders of old had used; and at such work the dwarves were still very skilled.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>

name: Argalad
text: Ranged. Action: Exhaust Argalad to choose an enemy in the staging area. Until the end of the phase, that enemy gets -X [threat], where X is Argalad's [attack]. If this effect reduces the enemy's [threat] to 0, deal 1 damage to it. (Limit once per round.)

name: Dwarven Sellsword
text: Forced: At the end of the round, discard Dwarven Sellsword unless the players as a group spend 1 [leadership] resource.
flavor:
...he did not altogether approve of dwarves and their love of gold...
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>

name: Dúnedain Remedy
text: Attach to a hero. Response: After Dúnedain Remedy is attached to a hero, heal 1 damage on that hero. Action: Pay 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to attach Dúnedain Remedy to another hero.

name: Marksman of Lórien
text: Ranged. Response: After Marksman of Lórien enters play, choose an enemy. That enemy gets -2 [defense] until the end of the round.
flavor:
"Keen are the eyes of the Elves."
<cite>Aragorn, The Two Towers</cite>

name: Battle-fury
text: Play only before the staging step. Quest Action: Exhaust a hero you control to immediately declare it as an attacker (and resolve its attack) against any eligible enemy target. Then, the players as a group may spend 1 [spirit] resource to commit that hero to the quest.
flavor:
Fey he seemed, or the battle-fury of his fathers ran like new fire in his veins...
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Woodland Courier
text: Response: After Woodland Courier enters play, place 1 progress on a location (2 progress instead if that location has the Forest trait).

name: Hithlain
text: Attach to a location. Limit 1 per location Response: After a player plays a Silvan ally from his hand, place 1 progress on attached location.
flavor:
He made his end of the rope fast about another tree, and then ran lightly along it, over the river and back again, as if he were on a round.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Robin Smallburrow
text: Response: After you travel to a location, spend 1 [spirit] resource to raise the engagement cost of each enemy in play by X until the end of the round, where X is that location's quest points. Any player may trigger this response.
flavor:
"Gave me a chance of walking round the country and seeing folk, and hearing the news, and knowing where the good beer was."
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Interrogation
text: Action: Choose an enemy with an attached Trap card. Look at the top X cards of the encounter deck, where X is that enemy's printed [threat]. You may discard 1 of those cards. Return the rest to the top of the deck, in the same order.

name: Strider
text:
Attach to a hero.
While you control 2 or fewer heroes, attached hero does not exhaust to commit to the quest.
While you control 5 or fewer characters, attached hero gets +2 [willpower].
flavor:
"Strider can take you by paths that are seldom tridden. Will you have him?"
<cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Na'asiyah
text: Resources in Na'asiyah's resource pool cannot be used to pay for allies. Action: While Na'asiyah is attacking or defending, pay 1 resource from her resource pool to give her +2 [attack] or +2 [defense] for this attack.

name: Rune-master
text: Attach to a Ranger or [leadership] hero. Response: After a Signal attachment is attached to a hero, exhaust Rune-master to add 1 resource to that hero's resource pool.

name: Terrible to Behold
text: Response: After you declare a Noble character as a defender against an attack made by an engaged enemy, return that enemy to the staging area. Then, cancel the attack.
flavor: So great a power and royalty was revealed in Aragorn...that many of the wild men paused, and looked back over their shoulders to the valley, and some looked up doubtfully at the sky. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: Veteran Sword-elf
text: Veteran Sword-elf gets +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] for each copy of Veteran Sword-elf in your discard pile.
flavor:
The elves were the first to charge. Their hatred for the goblins is cold and bitter.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>

name: Vigilant Guard
text: Attach to a Warrior character. Limit 1 per character. Attached character gets +2 hit points. Response: When another character would be assigned any amount of damage, place 1 of that damage on attached character instead.

name: Knife-work
text: Action: Choose a player. Each enemy engaged with that player gets -1 [defense] until the end of the phase. Then, the players as a group may spend 2 [lore] resources to have the chosen player draw 1 card each time he attacks and destroys an enemy this phase.
flavor:
"Good!" said Legolas. "But my count is now two dozen. It has been knife-work up here."
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: Linhir Sea-captain
text: Response: After you play Linhir Sea-captain from your hand, if you paid all of its resouce cost from a single hero's resource pool, both that hero and Linhir Sea-captain do not exhaust to quest this round.

name: Windfola
text: Attach to a [spirit] hero, or to Éowyn. Restricted. Attached character gets +1 [willpower]. Response: After attached character is removed from the quest, exhaust Windfola to commit attached hero to the quest.
flavor: ...the great grey steed Windfola made little of the burden; for Dernhelm was less in weight than many men, though lithe and well-knit in frame. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Ioreth
text: Cannot attack or defend. Action: Spend 1 [lore] resource and exhaust Ioreth. Then, heal 3 points of damage on a character. Any player may trigger this action.
flavor: Thus spake Ioreth, wise-woman of Gondor: The hands of the king are the hands of a healer, and so shall the rightful king be known. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: The Houses of Healing
text: You may exhaust any number of Healer characters you control as part of this card's cost. Reduce the cost to play this card by 1 for each Healer character you exhaust in this way. Refresh Action: Choose a hero in any player's discard pile. Put that hero into play under its owner's control, with 1 damage token on it.

name: Justice Shall Be Done
text: Limit 1 per deck. Planning Action: Add Justice Shall Be Done to the victory display to draw 3 cards and add 3 resources to the resource pool of each hero you control. At the end of the round, you are eliminated from the game.
flavor:
"...it is the last move in a great jeopardy, and for one side or the other it will bring the end of the game."
<cite>Aragorn, The Return of the King</cite>

name: Prince Imrahil
text: Combat Action: Spend 1 resource from Prince Imrahil's resource pool to search the top 5 cards of your deck for an ally who shares at least 1 Trait with him, and put that ally into play. Shuffle your deck. At the end of the phase, if that ally is still in play, shuffle it into your deck. (Limit once per round.)

name: Knight of the White Tower
text: Knight of the White Tower's resource cost must be paid from a single hero’s resource pool.
flavor:
"...to be only a man of arms of the Guard of the Tower of Gondor is held worthy in the City, and such men have honour in the land." 
<cite>Beregond, The Return of the King</cite>

name: Hold the Line
text: Response: When an enemy attacks a player, that player may declare up to 3 eligible characters as defenders against this attack. Then, the players as a group may spend 2 [tactics] resources to ready each defending character that takes no damage from this attack.

name: Soldier of Dol Amroth
text: Response: After Soldier of Dol Amroth enters play, reduce the cost of the next [tactics] card you play this phase by 1.
flavor:
...he and his knights still held themselves like lords in whom the race of Númenor ran true.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Súlien
text: Action: Spend 1 [lore] resource to exhaust Súlien. Then, each location in the staging area gets –1 [threat] until the end of the phase. Any player may trigger this action.

name: Inspiring Presence
text: Action: Choose a hero you control. Each hero with lower threat cost than the chosen hero gets +2 [defense] until the end of the phase. Then, the players as a group may spend 2 [leadership] resources to give +2 [attack] to each hero with lower threat cost than the chosen hero until the end of the phase.
flavor:
Wherever he came men's hearts would lift again, and the winged shadows pass from memory.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: Guardian of Ithilien
text: Response: After Guardian of Ithilien enters play, return an enemy engaged with you to the staging area.
flavor:
From such men the Lord Denethor chose his forayers…to harry the Orcs and other enemies that roamed between the Ephel Dúath and the River.
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: Ranger Spear
text: Attach to a Ranger character. Restricted. Attached character gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead when attacking an enemy with an attachment on it).
flavor:
Two had spears in their hands with broad bright heads.
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: Prince of Dol Amroth
text: Attach to Prince Imrahil. Price Imrahil gains the Outlands trait. While you control Outlands allies that belong to 4 different spheres, add 1 additional resource to Prince Imrahil's resource pool when you collect resources during the resource phase (if Prince Imrahil is a hero).

name: Bilbo Baggins
text: The first player gains control of Bilbo Baggins. Bilbo Baggins cannot gain resources from player card effects. If Bilbo Baggins leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: Thorin Oakenshield
text: If you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, add 1 additional resource to Thorin Oakenshield's pool when you collect resources during the resource phase.
flavor: "I am Thorin son of Thrain son of Thror, King under the Mountain!" <cite>Thorin, The Hobbit</cite>

name: Nori
text: Response: After you play a Dwarf character from your hand, reduce your threat by 1.
flavor: "Nori, at your service." <cite>Nori, The Hobbit</cite>

name: Ori
text: If you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, draw 1 additional card at the beginning of the resource phase.
flavor: "He could write well and speedily, and often used the Elvish characters." <cite>Gimli, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Beorn
text:
Sentinel. Cannot have attachments.
Immune to player card effects.
Beorn does not exhaust to defend.
flavor:
