text: While the active location has an attachment on it, Haldan does not exhaust to quest. Response: When the active location is explored, draw 1 card for each attachment on it.

name: Wiglaf
text: Response: After you play Wiglaf, play an Item attachment on him from your hand for no cost. Action: Exhaust an attachment on Wiglaf to ready him. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Ancestral Armor
text: Attach to a [leadership] or Noble character. Restricted. Limit 1 per character Attached characters gets +2 [defense] and +2 hit points.
flavor: "May it keep you well!" said Theoden. "It was made for me in Thengel's day, while still I was a boy." - The Two Towers

name: Glamdring
text: Guarded (enemy or location) Attach to a hero or Gandalf. Restricted. Attached character gets +2 [attack] Response: After attached character destroys an enemy, draw 1 card.

name: Woodmen's Path
text:
Attach to a location with no progress tokens on it.
While attached location is the active location, reduce its quest point value to 1.
flavor:
It was a path made by strong arms and heavy feet.
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Meneldor
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Response: After Meneldor enters or leaves play, place 2 progress on a location.
flavor: ...Meneldor young and swift. -The Return of the King

name: Flight of the Eagles
text: Action: Return an Eagle ally to your hand to shuffle a set-aside Eagle of the North into the encounter deck. Then, remove Flight of the Eagles from the game.
flavor:
Behind them in long swift lines came all their vassals from the northern mountains, speeding on a gathering wind.
-The Return of the King

name: Wild Stallion
text: Cannot have attachments Planning Action: Attach Wild Stallion to an ally you control. (Counts as a Mount attachment with the text: "Restricted. Limit 1 per ally. Attached ally gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], +1 [defense], and +1 hit point.")

name: South Away!
text: Travel Action: Choose a location in the staging area with a player card attachment and make it the active location, returning any previous active location to the staging area. Reduce each player's threat by X, where X is the number of attachments on the active location.
flavor:
South away! and South away!
Seek the sunlight and the day
- The Hobbit

name: Eagle of the North
text: Encounter. Surge. Cannot have restricted attachments. When Revealed: The first player chooses a player to take control of Eagle of the North. The chosen player may choose and discard a non-unique enemy in the staging area.

name: Thranduil
text: Combat Action: Play a Silvan ally from your hand. You do not need a resource match for this ally. (Limit once per round.)
flavor:
"It is a crime to wander in my realm without leave."
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>

name: The Elvenking
text: Attach to a Silvan hero. Action: Exhaust The Elvenking and return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to ready attached hero.
flavor:
In a great hall with pillars hewn out of the living stone sat the Elvenking on a chair of carven wood.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>

name: Orcrist
text: Guarded (enemy or location). Attach to a hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +2 [attack]. Response: After attached hero destroys an enemy, add 1 resource to attached hero's pool.

name: Forest Road Traveler
text: Forest Road Traveler gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], and +1 [defense] for each attachment on the active location.
flavor:
Only on the Road would travellers be found...
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Leather Boots
text: Attach to a [lore] or Ranger character. Limit 1 per character. Response: After a location is revealed from the encounter deck, exhaust Leather Boots to ready attached character.
flavor:
His legs were stretched out before him, showing high boots of supple leather that fitted him well...
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Giant Bear
text: Cannot have attachments. Action: Ready Giant Bear. At the end of the phase in which you triggered this effect, shuffle Giant Bear back into your deck. (Limit once per phase.)
flavor:
"As a bear he ranges far and wide."
<cite>Gandalf, The Hobbit</cite>

name: Outmatched
text: Play into your play area unattached. If unattached, attach to the next eligible enemy that engages you. Response: After attached enemy resolves its attack, ready the defending character.

name: Galion
text: Cannot attack or defend. Response: After Galion enters play, he gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the round.
flavor:
"Here am I waiting and waiting down here, while you fellows drink and make merry and forget your tasks. Small wonder if I fall asleep from weariness!"
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>

name: Quicker Than Sight
text: Response: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to cancel a shadow effect just triggered during combat.
flavor:
"You would die before your stroke fell."
<cite>Legolas, Th Two Towers</cite>

name: Thalion
text:
While there is at least 1 side quest in the victory display, ready Thalion at the beginning of the combat phase. 
While there are at least 3 side quests in the victory display, Thalion loses the ally card type, gains the hero card type and the resource icons of each sphere on a side quest in the victory display.

name: Dáin Ironfoot
text: While Dáin Ironfoot is defending, he gains, 'Action: Discard the top card of your deck to give Dáin Ironfoot +1 [defense] for this attack. (Limit 3 times per phase.)'

name: Soldier of Erebor
text: Action: Discard the top 3 cards from your deck to ready Soldier of Erebor. (Limit once per round.)

name: Man the Walls
text: Play only if no other copies of Man the Walls have been played this round. Planning Action: Reduce the cost of the next ally played by each player this phase by 1. Those allies cannot quest this round.

name: Mirkwood Hunter
text:
Ranged.
Reduce the cost to play Mirkwood Hunter by 1 for each attachment on the active location.

name: Familiar Lands
text: Action: Each location with an attachment gets -2 [threat] until the end of the phase.

name: Warrior Sword
text: Restricted. Attach to a [tactics] or Warrior character. Limit 1 per character. Attached character gets +1 [attack] for each enemy engaged with you. (Limit +3 [attack].)

name: Swift and Strong
text: Response: After a character you control attacks and destroys an enemy, exhaust a Weapon attached to that character to ready that character and give it +2 [attack] for its next attack this phase.

name: Descendant of Girion
text: Reduce the cost to play Item attachments on Descendant of Girion by 1.

name: Valiant Determination
text: Attach to an ally. Attached ally does not exhaust to quest.

name: Ring of Thrór
text: Guarded (enemy or location). Attach to a Dwarf hero. Action: Exhaust Thrór's Ring and discard the top card of your deck to ready attached hero. If the discarded card is an attachment, put it into play.

name: Bilbo Baggins
text: Response: After Bilbo Baggins commits to the quest, choose an enemy in the staging area. Until the end of the phase, Bilbo Baggins gets +X [willpower] where X is that enemy’s [threat]. If the players quest successfully, deal 1 damage to that enemy (2 damage instead if it is guarding a card).

name: Greenwood Defender
text: Response: After Greenwood Defender enters play, it does not exhaust to defend until the end of the round.
flavor: ...after the coming of Men they took ever more and more to the gloaming and the dusk. —The Hobbit

name: Elf Guide
text: Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to choose a hero. Add 1 resource to that hero’s pool.
flavor: ...soon Haldir turned aside into the trees and halted on the bank of the river under their shadows. —The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Gaffer Gamgee
text: Combat Action: Return Gaffer Gamgee to your hand to choose an enemy with engagement cost higher than your threat. Until the end of the round, that enemy cannot attack you.
flavor: "Why? Why’s none of my business, or yours." —The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Drinking Song
text: Action: Count the number of cards in your hand and shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw an equal number of cards. Draw 1 additional card if you control a unique Hobbit character.
flavor:
Ho! Ho! Ho! to the bottle I go 
To heal my heart and drown my woe. 
—The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Sting
text: Guarded (enemy). Attach to a Hobbit hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], and +1 [defense]. Response: After attached hero is declared as an attacker or defender against an enemy, deal 1 damage to that enemy.

name: Round Shield
text: Attach to a character. Restricted. Response: After a shadow effect is triggered during combat, exhaust Round Shield to give attached character +2 [defense] for this attack.

name: Erebor Toymaker
text: Response: After you play Erebor Toymaker from your hand, reduce the cost of the next attachment played this phase by 2.
flavor: There were toys the like of which they had never seen before, all beautiful and some obviously magical. —The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Armor of Erebor
text:
Attach to a Dale or Dwarf character. Restricted. 
Attached character gets +1 [defense] and gains sentinel.
flavor: "We make good armour and keen swords, but we cannot again make mail or blade to match those that were made before the dragon came." —Glóin, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: The Shirefolk
text: Play only if each of your heroes is a Hobbit. Action: Reduce your threat by 4.
flavor: "If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world." —Thorin Oakenshield, The Hobbit

name: Radagast
text: You may use resources from Radagast's pool to pay for Creature allies of any sphere. Response: After you play a Creature card, Radagast does not exhaust to quest this round.
flavor:
"..he has much lore of herbs and beasts, and birds are especially his friends."
-Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Messenger Raven
text: Cannot attack, defend, of have attachments. Refresh Action: Return Messenger Raven to it's owner's hand and name a card type. Choose a player to look at the top card of his deck. If that card is the named type, add it to its owner's hand. If it is not, discard it.

name: The King's Return
text: Action: Search your deck for a Guarded attachment and put it into play. Shuffle your deck.
flavor:
His crown shall be upholden,
His harp shall be restrung,
His halls shall echo golden
To songs of yore re-sung
-The Hobbit

name: Loyal Hound
text: Cannot have attachments. Response: Discard Loyal Hound to cancel up to 2 damage just dealt to a hero you control.

name: The Great Hunt
text: You must use resources from 3 different heroes' pools to pay for this card. Combat Action: Choose and discard a non-unique enemy in the staging area.
flavor:
...it seemed they could hear the noise of a great hunt going by to the north of the path...
-The Hobbit

name: Bywater Shirriff
text: Bywater Shirriff gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], and +1 [defense] while you are engaged with an enemy with engagement cost higher than your threat.
flavor:
The Shirriffs was the name that the Hobbits gave to their police, or the nearest equivalent that they possessed.
-The Hobbit

name: Gwaihir's Debt
text: Play only if you control a unique character with the Istari trait and another unique character with the Eagle trait. Action: Search the top 5 cards of your deck for an Eagle or Istari ally and put it into play. Shuffle your deck. At the end of the round, if that ally is still in play, return it to your hand.

name: Mithril Shirt
text: Guarded (location). Guarded (location). Attach to a hero. Response: When attached hero is dealt any amount of damage, reduce that damage by 1.
flavor:
It was of silver-steel which the Elves call mithril, and with it went a belt of pearls and crystals.
-The Hobbit

name: Reforged
text: Action: Choose an attachment with a printed cost of X in any player's discard pile and play that attachment for no cost. (The chosen attachment can belong to any sphere of influence.)
flavor: The Sword of Elendil was forged anew by Elvish smiths... -The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Radagast's Staff
text: Attach to Radagast. Action: Exhaust Radagast's Staff to choose one: Reduce the cost of the next Creature ally you play this phase by 2, ready a Creature ally, or return a non-unique Creature enemy engaged with you to the staging area.

name: Aragorn
text: Sentinel. Response: After Aragorn commits to a quest, spend 1 resource from his resource pool to ready him.
flavor:
"I am Aragorn son of Arathorn; and if by life or death I can save you, I will."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: Gildor Inglorion
text: Action: Pay 1 resource from Gildor Inglorion's resource pool to choose a player to draw 1 card (Limit once per round.)
flavor:
"Gildor Inglorion of the House of Finrod. We are Exiles, and most of our kindred have long ago departed...
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Nori
text: Response: After you play a Dwarf character from your hand, reduce your threat by 1.
flavor: Nori, at your service." -Nori, The Hobbit

name: Gandalf
text: At the end of the round, discard Gandalf from play. Response: After Gandalf enters play, (choose 1): draw 3 cards, deal 4 damage to 1 enemy in play, or reduce your threat by 5.

name: Galadriel
text: At the end of the round, discard Galadriel from play. Response: After you play Galadriel from your hand, search the top 5 cards of your deck for an attachment of cost 3 or less and put it into play. Put the remaining cards back in any order.

name: Gimli
text: Sentinel. Response: After an enemy is revealed from the encounter deck, ready Gimli.
flavor:
"Give me a row of orc-necks and room to swing and all weariness will fall from me!"
-The Two Towers

name: Faramir
text: Action: Exhaust Faramir to choose a player. Each character controlled by that player gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.
flavor:
"He leads now in all perilous ventures."
-Mablung, The Two Towers

name: Arwen Undómiel
text: Response: After Arwen Undómiel exhausts, choose a character. That character gains sentinel and gets +1 [defense] until the end of the round.
flavor:
"...she was the Evenstar of her people."
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Orophin
text: Ranged. Response: After Orophin enters play, return a Silvan ally from your discard pile to your hand.
flavor:
"Orophin has now gone in haste back to our dwellings to warn our people."
-Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Bofur
text: Quest Action: Spend 1 [spirit] resource to put Bofur into play from your hand, exhausted and commited to a quest. If you quest successfully this phase and Bofur is still in play, return him to your hand.
flavor:
"Get up lazy-bones..."
-The Hobbit

name: Fili
text: Response: After you play Fili from your hand during the planning phase, seach your deck for Kili and put him into play under your control. Then shuffle your deck.
flavor:
"Fili is the youngest and still has the best sight."
-Thorin, The Hobbit

name: Kili
text: Response: After you play Kili from your hand during the planning phase, seach your deck for Fili and put him into play under your control. Then shuffle your deck.
flavor:
"Let us join the throng!"
-The Hobbit

name: Silverlode Archer
text: Ranged.
flavor:
"We have been keeping watch on the rivers, ever since we saw a great troop of Orcs going north towards Moria, along the skirts of the mountains, many days ago."
-Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Defender of the Naith
text: Sentinel. Response: After a Silvan ally you control leaves play, ready Defender of the Naith.
flavor:
"You cannot cross the rivers again, and behind you there are now secret sentinels that you cannot pass."
-Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Andrath Guardsman
text: Response: After you play Andrath Guardsman from your hand, choose a non-unique enemy engaged with you. That enemy cannot attack you this round.
flavor:
They forgot or ignored what little they had ever known of the Guardians...
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Woodland Courier
text: Response: After Woodland Courier enters play, place 1 progress on a location (2 progress instead if that location has the Forest trait.

name: Naith Guide
text: Response: After Naith Guide enters play, choose a hero. That hero does not exhaust to quest this round.
flavor:
"I shall lead you well..."
-Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Blue Mountain Trader
text: Action: Choose another player. That player gains control of Blue Mountain Trader. Then, the player moves 1 resource from the resource pool of a hero he controls to the resource pool of a hero you control, or Blue Mountain Trader is discarded. (Limit once per round.)

name: Dwarven Sellsword
text: Forced: At the end of the round, discard Dwarven Sellsword unless the players as a group spend 1 [leadership] resource.
flavor:
...he did not altogether approve of the dwarves and their love of gold...
-The Hobbit

name: Celebrían's Stone
text:
Restricted.
Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains +2 [willpower]. If attached hero is Aragorn, he also gains a [spirit] resource icon.

name: Steward of Gondor
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains the Gondor trait. Action: Exhaust Steward of Gondor to add 2 resources to attached hero's resource pool.

name: Light of Valinor
text: Attach to a Nolder or Silvan hero. Attached hero does not exhaust to commit to a quest.
flavor:
"...those who have dwelt in the Blessed Ralm live at once in both worlds, and against both the Seen and Unseen they have great power."
-Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Unexpected Courage
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Exhaust Unexpected Courage to ready attached hero.
flavor:
"You cannot trap me, though you try,
in your cobwebs crazy."
-Bilbo Baggins, The Hobbit

name: Ancient Mathom
text: Attach to a location. Response: After attached location is explored, the first player draws 3 cards.
flavor:
...anything that Hobbits had no immediate use for, but were unwilling to throw away, they called mathom.
The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Cram
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Discard Cram to ready attached hero.
flavor:
If you want to know what cram is, I can only say that I don"t know the recipe; but it is biscuitish, keeps good indefinitely, is supposed to be sustaining, and is certainly not entertaining...
-The Hobbit

name: Grim Resolve
text: Action: Ready all characters in play.
flavor:
"If there is only one way, then I muse take it. What comes after must come."
-Frodo Baggins, The Two Towers

name: Sneak Attack
text: Action: Put 1 ally card into play from your hand. At the end of the phase, if that ally is still in play, return it to your hand.
flavor:
There is a seed of courage hidden (often deeply, it is true) in the heart of the fattest and most timid hobbit...
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: A Test of Will
text: Response: Cancel the 'when revealed' effects of a card that was just revealed from the encounter deck.
flavor:
"There is naught that you can do, other than resist, with hope or without it."
-Elrond, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Ever Vigilant
text: Action: Choose and ready 1 ally card.
flavor:
"...no road looks toward safety any longer. Be vigilant!"
-Gandalf, The Return of the King

name: Hasty Stroke
text: Response: Cancel a shadow effect just triggered during combat.
flavor:
"The hasty stroke goes oft astray," said Aragorn. "We must press our Enemy, and no longer wait upon him for the move."
-The Return of the King

name: Desperate Defense
text: Response: After a sentinel character is declared as a defender, it gets +2 [defense] for this attack. If this attack deals no damage, ready the defending character.
flavor:
...but along in the porch upon the topmost step stood Beregond...
-The Return of the King

name: Dwarven Tomb
text: Action: Return a [spirit] card from your discard pile to your hand.
flavor:
The dwarves of yore made might spells,
While hammers fell like rining bells
In places deep, where dark things sleep...
-The Hobbit

name: Feigned Voices
text: Combat Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to choose an enemy engaged with a player. That enemy cannot attack that player this phase.
flavor:
"...we went ahead and spoke with feigned voices..."
-Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Glorfindel
text: Action: Pay 1 resource from Glorfindel's pool to heal 1 damage on any character. (Limit once per round.)
flavor:
"You saw him for a moment as he is upon the other side: one of the mighty of the firstborn."
-Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Bifur
text: Action: Pay 1 resource from a hero's resource pool to add 1 resource to Bifur's resource pool. Any player may trigger this ability. (Limit once per round.)
flavor: And winter comes after autumn." - Bifur, The Hobbit

name: Thorin Stonehelm
text: Response: After Thorin Stonehelm is declared as an attacker, discard the top card of your deck to deal 1 damage to an enemy engaged with you.
flavor:
Thorin III Stonehelm, Dain"s son, became King under the mountain.
-The Return of the King

name: Gandalf
text: At the end of the round, discard Gandalf from play. Response: After Gandalf enters play, (choose 1): draw 3 cards, deal 4 damage to 1 enemy in play, or reduce your threat by 5.

name: Legolas
text: Ranged. Response: After Legolas participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, draw 1 card.
flavor:
"He stands not alone," said Legolas, bending his bow and fitting an arrow with hands that moved quicker than sight.
-The Two Towers

name: Haldir of Lórien
text: Ranged. Sentinel.
flavor:
"But there are some of use who still go abroad for the gathering of news and the watching of our enemies, and they speak the languages of other lands."
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Elrond
text: At the end of the round, discard Elrond from play. Response: After Elrond enters play, choose one: heal all damage on a hero, discard a Condition attachment, or each player draws 1 card.

name: Azain Silverbeard
text: Response: After Azain Silverbeard participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, spend 1 [tactics] resource to deal 2 damage to another enemy that shares a Trait with the destroyed enemy. Any player may trigger this response.

name: Mablung
text: Response: After Mablung enters play, choose an enemy to get +5 enagement cost until the end of the round. Then, you may engage that enemy, or return it to the staging area
flavor:
"But still we will not sit idle and let Him do all as He would."
-The Two Towers

name: Henamarth Riversong
text: Action: Exhaust Henamarth Riversong to look at the top card of the encounter deck.
flavor:
"And I reckon there"s Elves and Elves. They"re all elvish enough, but they"re not all the same."
-Sam Gamgee, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Ioreth
text: Cannot attack or defend. Action: Spend 1 [lore] resource to exhaust Ioreth. Then, heal 3 points of damage from a character. Any player may trigger this action.

name: Sarn Ford Sentry
text: Response: After Sarn Ford Sentry enters play, draw 1 card for each enemy engaged with you.
flavor:
"Lonely men are we, Rangers of the wild, hunters but hunters ever of the servants of the Enemy..."
-Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Erebor Hammersmith
text: Response: After you play Erebor Hammersmith, return the topmost attachment in any player's discard pile to his hand.
flavor:
"In Erebor in the Kingdom of Dain there is such skill..."
-Aragorn, The Return of the King

name: Galadhon Archer
text: Ranged. Response: After Galadhon Archer enters play, deal 1 damage to an enemy not engaged with you.
flavor:
"...you breathe so loud that they could shoot you in the dark."
-Legolas, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Galadhrim Minstrel
text: Response: After Galadhrim Minstrel enters play, search the top 5 cards of your deck for an event card and add it to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
flavor:
...the language was of Elven-song and spoke of things little now in Middle-earth.
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Defender of Rammas
flavor:
"And the Enemy must pay dearly for the crossing of the River."
-Denethor, The Return of the King

name: Dúnedain Lookout
text: Response: Discard Dúnedain Lookout to cancel the 'when revealed' effects of an enemy just revealed from the encounter deck.
flavor:
"Travellers scowl at us and countrymen give us scornful names."
-Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Envoy of Pelargir
text: Response: After Envoy of Pelargir enters play, add 1 resource to a Gondor or Noble hero's resource pool.

name: Horn of Gondor
text: Restricted. Attach to a hero. Response: After a character is destroyed, add 1 resource to attached hero's pool.
flavor:
"Slow should you be to wind that horn again, Boromir," said Elrond, "until you stand once more on the border of your land, and dire need is on you."
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Elf-stone
text: Attach to the active location. Attached location gets +1 quest point. Response: After attached location leaves play as an explored location, the first player puts 1 ally into play from his hand.

name: Dwarrowdelf Axe
text: Attach to a Dwarf character. Restricted. Attached hero gains +1 [attack]. Response: After attached character attacks, deal 1 damage to the defending enemy.

name: Blade of Gondolin
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +1 [attack] when attacking an Orc. Response: After attached hero attacks and destroys an enemy, place 1 progress token on the current quest.

name: Lembas
text: Play only if you control a Noldor or Silvan hero. Attach to a hero. Action: Discard Lembas to ready attached hero and heal 3 damage from it.

name: The Long Defeat
text: Attach to a quest card in play. Limit 1 per quest. Response: After attached quest is defeated, each player either draws 2 cards or heals up to 5 damage from among characters he controls.
flavor:
"...through the ages of the world we have fought the long defeat."
-Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Gildor's Counsel
text: Play during the Quest phase, before characters are commited to the Quest. Action: Reveal 1 less card from the encounter deck this phase. (To a minimum of 1.)

name: Feint
text: Combat Action: Choose an enemy engaged with a player. That enemy cannot attack that player this phase.
flavor:
A few brave men were strung before them to make a feint of resistance, and many there fell before the rest drew back and fled to either side.
-The Hobbit

name: Secret Paths
text: Quest Action: Choose a location in the staging area. Until the end of the phase, that location does not contribute its [threat].
flavor: ...Beorn advised them to take this way; for at a place a few days" ride due north of the Carrock was the gate of a little-known pathway through Mirkwood... -The Hobbit

name: Quick Strike
text: Action: Exhaust a character you control to immediately declare it as an attacker (and resolve its attack) against any eligible enemy target.
flavor: ...for he that strikes the first blow, if he strikes it hard enough, may need to strike no more." -Gandalf, The Two Towers 1 2 3 Sara Biddle 73cd6d76-7d03-4519-874a-a7697b9a0ef3 Two-Player Limited Edition Starter Event Lore 62 20062 Ancestral Knowledge Action: Exhaust a Dwarf character to place 2 progress tokens on the active location. (4 progress tokens instead if it is an Underground or Mountain location.) ""There is a land where our fathers worked of old..." Gimli, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Ancestral Knowledge
text: Action: Exhaust a Dwarf character to place 2 progress tokens on the active location. (4 progress tokens instead if it is an Underground or Mountain location.)
flavor:
"There is a land where our fathers worked of old..."
Gimli, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Khazâd! Khazâd!
text: Action: Choose a Dwarf character. Until the end of the phase, that character gets +3 [attack].
flavor:
Down from the wall leapt Gimli with a fierce cry the echoed in the cliffs. "Khazâd! Khazâd!" He soon had work enough.
-The Two Towers

name: Daeron's Runes
text: Action: Draw 2 cards. Then, discard 1 card for your hand.
flavor:
"These are Daeron"s Runes, such as were used of old in Moria..."
-Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Pursuing the Enemy
text: Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to choose a player. Deal 1 damage to each enemy engaged with that player.
flavor:
The marauding orcs had been waylaid and almost all destroyed...
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: The One Ring
text: Restricted. Immune to non-Master card effects. Setup: Attach to a hero you control and search your deck for a Master card. Add it to your hand and shuffle your deck. Your threat elimination level is reduced by 5. If The One Ring leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: Frodo Baggins
text: Response: After Frodo Baggins commits to the quest, spend 1 resource from his resource pool to ready another unique character committed to the quest. If you quest successfully this phase, reduce your threat by 1.
flavor:
"Keep your tempers and hold your hands to the last possible moment!"
-The Return of the King

name: Merry
text: Response: After Merry enters play, each unique ally you control gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the round.
flavor:
"Shire-folk have been so comfortable so long they don"t know what to do. They just want a match, though, and they"ll go up in fire."
-The Return of the King

name: Pippin
text: Pippin gets +2 [attack] while attacking an enemy with an engagement cost higher than your threat. Response: After you engage an enemy with an engagement cost higher than your threat, ready Pippin.
flavor:
"Down on your knees in the road and ask pardon, or I will set this troll"s bane in you!"
-The Return of the King

name: Faramir
text: Response: After Faramir enters play, choose a non-unique enemy in the staging area. Engage that enemy and deal 2 damage to it (4 damage instead if it has an attachment on it).
flavor:
"There will be hard handstrokes nigh at hand ere the day is full."
-The Two Towers

name: Derufin
text: Ranged. Ranged. Response: After Derufin participates in an attack which destroys an enemy engaged with a player, discard Derufin to reduce the engaged player's threat by X, where X is the destroyed enemy's printed [threat].

name: The Gathering Storm
text: Planning Action: Search the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for an enemy. Add that enemy to the staging area to reduce the cost of the first ally you play this phase by X, where X is that enemy's [threat]. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Put Off Pursuit
text: Attach to the active location. Limit 1 per location. Attached location gets +2 quest points. Response: After attached location is explored, discard cards from the encounter deck until a location is discarded. Add that location to the staging area to choose an non-unique enemy in the staging area and shuffle it into the encounter deck.

name: The Master Ring
text: Response: Exhaust The One Ring and raise your threat by 1 to cancel the effects of an encounter card just revealed from the encounter deck and discard that card. Then, reveal an encounter card.
flavor:
"If I, wearing it, were to command you, you would obey, even if it were to leap from a precipice or to cast yourself into the fire."
-Frodo, The Two Towers

name: The Ruling Ring
text: Combat Action: Exhaust The One Ring and raise your threat by 1 to choose a non-Nazgul enemy engaged with you. Until the end of the phase, that enemy cannot attack you.
flavor:
"He vanished. I have never seen such a thing happen before..."
-Boromir, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: The Ring of Power
text: Action: Exhaust The One Ring and raise your threat by 1 to ready the hero with The One Ring Attached. That hero gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], and +1 [defense] until the end of the phase.
flavor:
"And behold! in our need chance brings to light the Ring of Power."
-Boromir, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Sméagol
text: Side A Cannot have attachments. Setup: Shuffle 2 copies of Stinker into the encounter deck. Response: After you travel to a location, raise your threat by 1 to draw 1 card. Side B Immune to non-Gollum card effects. Gollum engages the first player. Forced: When Gollum is defeated, flip him to Sméagol and return him to his owner's control, exhausted.

name: Fellowship
text: Side A You cannot play non-unique allies or put non-unique allies into play. Forced: When you control exactly 9 unique characters, flip this card over. Side B You cannot play allies or put allies into play. Each character you control gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], and +1 [defense]. Forced: After a character you control leaves play, flip this card over.
flavor:
"I will choose you companions to go with you, as far as they will or fortune allows. The number must be few, since your hope is in speed and secrecy."
-Elrond, The Fellowship of the Ring
"The company of the Ring shall be Nine; and the Nine Walkers shall be set against the Nine Riders that are evil."
-Elrond, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Thorin Stonehelm
text: Response: After Thorin Stonehelm is declared as an attacker, discard the top card of your deck to deal 1 damage to an enemy engaged with you.
flavor:
Thorin III Stonehelm, Dain"s son, became King under the mountain.
-The Return of the King

name: Soldier of Gondor
text: Response: After Soldier of Gondor enters play, search the top 5 cards of your deck for a Gondor ally and add it to your hand (any number of Gondor allies instead if your threat is 40 or higher). Shuffle your deck.

name: Pillars of the Kings
text: While your threat is less than 40, reduce the cost to play Pillars of the Kings by 4. Action: Set your threat to 40. If this effect raised your threat, draw a card (draw 4 cards instead if it raised your threat by 10 or more).
flavor:
"Behold the Argonath, the Pillars of the Kings!"
-Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Cautious Halfling
text: Response: After Cautious Halfling enters play, look at the top card of the encounter deck. If that card is not an enemy, draw a card.
flavor:
"I thought I had been both careful and clever."
-Frodo, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Tom Bombadillo!
text: Play only if you control a Hobbit hero. You cannot play this card if there is a copy of Tom Bombadillo! in the victory display. Planning Action: Add Tom Bombadillo the the victory display to shuffle a set-aside copy of Tom Bombadil into the encounter deck.

name: Durin's Axe
text: Guarded (enemy). Restricted. Guarded (enemy). Restricted. Attach to a hero. Attached hero gets +2 [attack]. Response: After attach hero attacks and destroys an enemy, deal 1 damage to an enemy engaged with you.

name: Charge into Battle
text: Play only after staging step. Quest Action: You may declare and resolve an attack against each non-unique enemy in the staging are as if it were engaged with you.
flavor:
Panic came upon the Goblins; and even as they turned to meet this new attack, the elves charged again with renewed numbers.
-The Hobbit

name: Silver Circlet
text: Restricted. Attach to a [spirit] hero. Limit 1 per hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +2 [willpower].
flavor:
His hair was dark as the shadows of twilight, and upon it was set a circlet of silver...
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Inner Strength
text: Attach to the hero with The One Ring. Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero gets +1 [defense]. Response: Exhaust The One Ring and raise your threat by 1 to cancel a shadow effect just triggered during an attack that attached hero is defending.

name: Tom Bombadil
text: Encounter. When Revealed: Choose a player. That player gains control of Tom Bombadil, ready and committed to the quest. At the end of the round, remove Tom Bombadil and a copy of Tom Bombadillo! in the victory display from the game. This effect cannot be cancelled.

name: The Burglar's Turn
text: Side A You cannot include attachments in your deck. Setup: Choose 14 different Item or Artifact attachments from your collection and shuffle them together. This is your loot deck. Flip this card over and place your loot deck facedown under it. Side B The active location gets +1 quest point for each attachment attached to it. Forced: After you travel to a location, attach the top card of your loot deck faceup to that location as a guarded objective. If that attachment has the guarded X keyword, ignore it. Forced: When the active location is explored, you may put each guarded attachment on that location into play at no cost, or add it to your hand.
flavor:
"And I assure you there is a mark on this door - the usual one in the trade, or used to be. Burglar wants a good job, plenty of Excitement and reasonably Reward, that"s how it is usually read.
-Glóin, The Hobbit

name: Lothíriel
text: If Éomer is in play, Lothíriel gains the Rohan trait. Response: After Lothíriel commits to a quest, choose an ally in your hand. If that ally shares a Trait with her, put that ally into play exhausted and committed to the quest. At the end of the phase, if that ally is still in play, shuffle it into your deck.

name: Angbor the Fearless
text: While your threat is 40 or higher, Angbor the Fearless gets +2 [attack] and does not exhaust to quest.
flavor:
"Four thousands I sent marching from Pelargir through Lossarnach two days ago; and Angbor the fearless rides before them."
-Aragorn, The Return of the King

name: Need Drives Them
text: Action: Each player whose threat is 40 or higher readies all characters he controls.
flavor:
"But I do not go gladly; only need drives me. Therefore, only of your free will would I have you come..."
-Aragorn, The Return of the King

name: Woodland Sentry
text: Response: After you play Woodland Sentry from your hand, choose an enemy or location in play. If there is a copy of that card in the victory display, discard the chosen card.
flavor:
In the Wide World the Wood-elves lingered in the twilight of our Sun and Moon but loved best the stars...
-The Hobbit

name: Keen Longbow
text: Attach to a [lore] hero. Limit 1 per hero. Restricted. Attached hero gains ranged. Response: After attached hero is declared an as attacker against an enemy, discard up to 3 cards from your hand to deal 1 damage to that enemy for each card discarded this way.

name: War Axe
text:
Attach to a [tactics] character. Limit 1 per character. 
Restricted. 
Attached characters gets +1 [attack] for each attachment it has with the restricted keyword.
flavor:
"Gimli Glóin"s son, have you your axe ready?"
-Éomer, The Return of the King

name: Strength and Courage
text: Attach to the hero with The One Ring. Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero gets +1 [attack]. Response: After attached hero is declared as an attacker, exhaust The One Ring and raise your threat by 1 to double attached hero's printed [attack] for this attack.

name: Knight of Belfalas
text: Response: After Knight of Belfalas enters play, return a Gondor ally from your discard pile to your hand.
flavor:
The mounted knights returned, and at their rear the banner of Dol Amroth...
-The Return of the King

name: Horn of the Mark
text: Attach to a Rohan hero or Merry. Restricted. Response: When a character leaves play, if that character shares at least one trait with the attached hero, exhaust Horn of the Mark to draw 1 card.
flavor:
Then Éowyn gave to Merry an ancient horn, small but cunningly wrought all of fair silver with a baldric of green...
-The Return of the King

name: Host of Galadhrim
text: Planning Action: Return each Silvan ally you control to your hand. Then, play each of those allies from your hand one at a time at no cost.
flavor:
Celeborn came forth and led the host of Lórien...
-The Return of the King

name: Forth, The Three Hunters!
text: Side A Your deck cannot include ally cards. Each of your heroes can have 1 additional restricted attachment. Reduce the cost of the first restricted attachment you play on each of your heroes each round by 1. Refresh Action: If each of your heroes has at least 2 restricted attachments, flip this card over. Side B Each of your heroes can have 1 additional restricted attachment and gets +1 [willpower] for each restricted attachment on it. Action: Exhaust this card to heal 1 damage from each of your heroes.
flavor:
"...we that remain cannot forsake our companions while we have strength left."
-Aragorn, The Two Towers
"With hope or without hope we will follow the trail of our enemies. And woe to them, if we prove the swifter!"
-Aragorn, The Two Towers

name: Saruman
text: When a player card effect would reduce your threat by any amount, reduce that amount to 1. When you play an event with the printed doomed keyword, Saruman gains the printed [leadership], [spirit], and [tactics] icons. Response: When you play a card with the Doomed keyword, ready Saruman.

name: Power of Command
text: Attach to the hero with The One Ring. Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero gets +1 [willpower]. Response: After attached hero commits to the quest, exhaust The One Ring and raise your threat by 1 to give each other unique character you control +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

name: Horns! Horns! Horns!
text: Doomed 2. Action: Each player may put one ally card into play from his hand. At the end of the phase, shuffle each of those allies that are still in play into their owners' decks.

name: Soldier of Isengard
text: Doomed 2. Response: After a player raises his threat from the doomed keyword, give control of Soldier of Isengard to that player.
flavor:
"...the keepers of the gate were on the watch for me and told me that Saruman awaited me."
-Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Far-sighted
text: Doomed 1. Action: Look at the top 5 cards of the encounter deck. Put them back in the same order.
flavor:
...Legolas was standing, gazing northwards into the darkness, thoughtful and silent as a young tree in a windless night.
-The Two Towers

name: Nori
text: Response: After Nori participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, put the top card of your discard pile on the bottom of your deck.
flavor:
"You've left the burglar behind again!"
-Nori, The Hobbit

name: Golden Belt
text:
Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero. 
Attached hero can have 1 additional restricted attachment.
flavor:
The lady bowed her head, and she turned then to Boromir, and to him she gave a belt of gold...
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Rohirrim Scout
text: Action: Discard Rohirrim Scout to choose a non-unique enemy in the staging area. That enemy does not make engagement checks against you this round.
flavor:
Swiftly a scout rode back and reported that wolf-riders were abroad in the valley...
-The Two Towers

name: The Muster of Rohan
text: While paying for The Muster of Rohan, each Rohan hero you control is considered to have a [spirit] icon. Planning Action: Search the top 10 cards of your deck for up to 4 Rohan allies and put them into play. Shuffle your deck. If any of those allies are still in play at the end of the round, discard them.

name: Saruman's Staff
text: Attach to Saruman. Restricted. Action: Exhaust Saruman's Staff to (choose one): Reduce the X value of the next Doomed X event you play this phase by 2, or search the top 5 cards of your deck for a Doomed event and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.)
flavor:
His hand clutched his heavy black staff like a claw.
-The Two Towers

name: The Grey Wanderer
text: Side A You cannot choose more than 1 starting hero. Setup: Search your deck for an attachment with a printed cost of 1 and put it into play. Then, flip this card over. Side B The first non-unique card you play each planning phase does not require a resource match. Action: Exhaust this card and raise your threat by 1 to (choose two): Ready your starting hero, add 2 resources to your starting hero's resource pool, or heal 3 damage from your starting hero.
flavor:
"...the rule of no realm is mine, neither of Gondor nor any other, great or small. But all worthy things that are in peril as the world now stands, those are my card."_x000D_
-Gandalf, The Return of the King
“...this shall be his great task, and maybe the end of his labours.”
–Elrond, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Gildor Inglorion
text: Action: Pay 1 resource from Gildor Inglorion's resource pool to choose a player to draw 1 card (Limit once per round.)
flavor:
"Gildor Inglorion of the House of Finrod. We are Exiles, and most of our kindred have long ago departed..."
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Wandering Exile
text: Response: After Wandering Exile commits to a quest, discard a card from your hand to ready Wandering Exile.
flavor:
"The Elves have their own labours and their own sorrows...
-Gildor, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Valiant Sword
text: Restricted. Attach to a Noble hero. Limit 1 per hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] if your threat is 40 or higher).
flavor:
...his sword of steel was valiant...
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Stone of Elostirion
text:
Guarded (location). Restricted.
Attach to a hero. Attached hero gets +2 [willpower]. You draw 1 additional card during the resource phase.
flavor:
Looking up he saw before him a tall white tower, standing alone on a high ridge. A great desire came over him to climb the tower and see the Sea.
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Well Preserved
text: Attach to the hero with The One Ring. Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero gets + 1 hit point. Response: At the beginning of the round, exhaust The One Ring and raise your threat by 1 to heal all damage from attached hero.

name: Northern Bowmaster
text:
Ranged.
You cannot play Northern Bowmaster from your hand unless you are engaged with an enemy.

name: Reckless Attack
text: Doomed 2. Action: Each player deals 2 damage to an enemy engaged with him.
flavor:
Down, heedless of order, rushed all the dwarves of Dain to his help.
-The Hobbit

name: Odo Proudfoot
text: Response: After Odo Proudfoot enters play, search the top 5 cards of your deck for a Hobbit ally and add it to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
flavor:
"ProudFEET! shouted an elderly hobbit from the back of the pavilion.
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Defiant Challenge
text: Doomed 2. Action: Each player may ready a character he controls.
flavor:
"Go back to the Shadow!"
-Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Helm of Secrecy
text: Limit 1 per deck. Action: Choose a hero you control and discard all tokens from it. Select a different non-[fellowship], non-[baggins] hero from your collection with a threat cost less than or equal to the chosen hero. Swap those heroes, moving all eligible attachments to the hero from your collection.

name: Council of the Wise
text: You cannot include more than 1 copy of a card, by title, in your deck. Response: After you play an event from your hand, choose one: reduce your threat by 1, draw 1 card, or add 1 resource to your hero's resource pool. You can only choose each option once per round.
flavor:
"I must go to this lords" council and learn what I can."
-Gandalf, The Return of the King

name: Gwaihir
text: Ranged. Sentinel. Cannot have restricted attachments. Gwaihir does not ready during the refresh phase. Response: After an Eagle ally enters or leaves play, ready Gwaihir. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Hobbit Archer
text:
Ranged.
Hobbit Archer gets +1 [attack] while attacking an enemy with a higher engagement cost than your threat.
flavor:
"If you lay a finger on this farmer, or on anyone else, you will be shot at once."
-Merry, The Return of the King

name: Red Book of Westmarch
text: Attach to a Hobbit hero. Restricted. While attached hero is committed to the quest, each Hobbit character gets +1 [willpower]. Response: After you quest successfully, exhaust Red Book of Westmarch to add 1 resource to attached hero's resource pool.

name: Dale Messenger
text: Response: After Dale Messenger enters play, choose a player. That player heals 1 damage from each character he controls with a player card attachment.
flavor:
"We discover that messengers have come also to King Brand in Dale..."
-Glóin, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Song of Healing
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero. Action: Discard 1 card from your hand to heal 1 damage from attached hero. Any player may trigger this effect.
flavor:
...behind him stood Galadriel, tall and white: a circlet of golden flowers was in her hair, and in her hand she held a hard, and she sang.
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Eagle Emissary
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Forced: After Eagle Emissary quests successfully, pay 1 [tactics] resource or discard it from play.
flavor:
...and out of the East there came a great Eagle flying, and he bore tidings beyond hope from The Lords of the West...
-The Return of the King

name: Bilbo's Plan
text: Response: After you attack and destroy an enemy, shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until an enemy is discarded. Add that enemy to the staging area to discard a non-unique location with [threat] equal to or less that that enemy's [threat].

name: Spare Pipe
text: Attach to a character. Attached character gets +1 hit point. Response: After you play Spare Pipe, search the top 5 cards of your deck for an event and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
flavor:
"I have carried it a long way, though I don"t know why."
-Pippin, The Two Towers

name: Smoke and Think
text: Action: Reduce the cost of the next card you play by 1 for each Pipe you control.
flavor:
Merry smiled. "Well then," he said, "if Strider will provide what is needed, I will smoke and think."
-The Return of the King

name: Wilyador
text: Ranged. Sentinel. Cannot have restricted attachments. Forced: At the end of the round, discard Wilyador unless the players as a group spend 1 resource.

name: Messenger of the King
text: Side A You cannot choose more than 2 heroes during setup. Setup: Choose a non-neutral unique ally from your deck and put it into play. Add the sum of that ally's printed [willpower], [attack], [defense], and hit points to your starting threat. Then, flip this card over and attach it to that ally. Side B Attached ally loses the ally card type and gains the hero card type Attached character cannot be readied more than once per phase Messenger of the King is immune to card effects while attached character is in play. If attached character leaves play, remove Messenger of the King from the game.
flavor:
"I am a messenger of the King" he said. "You are speaking to the King's friend, and one of the most renowned in all the lands of the West."
-Pippin, The Return of the King

name: Aragorn
text: Sentinel. Action: Exhaust Aragorn to choose a location in the staging area. Until the end of the phase, that location gets -X [threat], where X is Aragorn's [willpower]. If this effect reduces the location's [threat] to 0, place 1 progress on it. (Limit once per round.)

name: Shining Shield
text: Attach to a Noble hero. Limit 1 per hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +1 [defense] (+2 [defense] instead if your threat is 40 or higher).
flavor:
...his shinning shield was scored with runs...
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Knowledge of the Enemy
text: Planning Action: Choose a hero you control. Add 1 resource to its resource pool for each enemy engaged with you. You can only play 1 Knowledge of the Enemy each round.
flavor:
"If a man must needs walk in sight of the Black Gate, or tread the deadly flowers of Morgul Vale, then perils he will have."
-Aragorm, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Haleth
text: Response: After Haleth quests successfully, search the top 5 cards of your deck for an attachment and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

name: Woodman Lore
text: Action: Ready up to X Woodman characters you control, where X is the number of locations with player card attachments.
flavor:
The Woodman said that there was some new terror abroad...
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Westfold Lancer
text: Response: After Westfold Lancer quests successfully, discard it to choose a non-unique enemy in the staging area. Deal 2 damage to the chosen enemy.
flavor:
...the white fury of the Northmen burned the hotter, and more skilled was their knighthood with long spears...
-The Return of the King

name: Tireless Thoroughbred
text: Restricted. Attach to a Warrior character. Restricted. Attached character gains ranged and sentinel.
flavor:
Then he leapt forward, spurring the earth, and was gone like the north wine from the mountains.
-The Two Towers.

name: Misty Mountain Journeyman
text: You cannot play Misty Mountain Journeyman from your hand unless you are engaged with an enemy.
flavor:
Rangers passed at times beyond the hills, but they were few and did not stay.
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: A Desperate Path
text: Response: At the end of the staging step, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until you discard a treachery. Resolve its 'when revealed' effects to ready each of your questing characters. Each of your questing characters gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

name: Thorongil
text: Attach to a non-[fellowship], non-[baggins] hero you control. Response: After you attach Thorongil to a hero, search your collection for a different non-[fellowship], non-[baggins] version of that hero and attach it to Thorongil. While Thorongil is in play, attached hero gains the game text and resource icon of the attached hero card. If Thorongil leaves play, remove the hero card attached to it from the game.

name: Bond of Friendship
text:
Your deck must be exactly 50 players cards and include exactly 10 cards from each of these four spheres: [leadership], [lore], [spirit], and [tactics]. You cannot include more than 2 copies of any card by title in your deck.

When choosing your starting heroes, you may choose 4 heroes instead of 3. Each of your heroes must belong to a different sphere.
flavor:
"You can trust us to stick to you through think and thin - to the bitter end."
-Merry, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Ingold
text: Response: After a Gondor or Warrior ally enters play under your control, draw 1 card. Then, either spend 1 resource from Ingold’s pool or raise your threat by 1. (Limit once per phase.)
flavor: “We wish for no strangers in the land at this time, unless they be mighty men of arms in whose faith and help we can trust.” —The Return of the King

name: Celador
text: Ranged. Reduce the total [threat] in the staging area by 1 for each unattached Trap you control. Response: After a Trap card you control is attached to an enemy, either ready Celador or reduce your threat by 1.
flavor:
“Wise man trusts not to chance-meeting on the road in this land.”
—Faramir, The Two Towers

name: Thengel
text: Response: After an ally is discarded from play, that ally’s owner searches the top 5 cards of their deck for an ally that shares a Trait with the discarded ally, puts it into play exhausted, and shuffles their deck. (Limit once per round.)
flavor: “My friend,” said Gandalf, “you had horses, and deeds of arms, and the free fields.” —The Return of the King

name: Herubrand
text: Herubrand gets +1 [willpower] for each hero you control with at least 1 restricted attachment. Response: After an enemy in the staging area is destroyed, draw 1 card.
flavor:
“What burden do you bear, Men of Rohan?”
—Imrahil, The Return of the King

name: Deeping Bowman
text: Devoted. Ranged. Action: Discard Deeping Bowman to choose an enemy. Until the end of the phase, that enemy does not count its [defense] while determining combat damage.
flavor: “We loosed every arrow that we had, and filled the Dike with Orcs.” —The Two Towers

name: Open the Gates
text: Action: Search the top 5 cards of your deck for an ally that shares a Trait with each of your heroes and put it into play. Shuffle your deck. At the end of the phase, if that ally did not leave play, add it to your hand.
flavor: It seemed that word of their coming had gone before them; and at once they were admitted, silently, and without question. —The Return of the King

name: Wealth of Adventure
text: Action: Search your deck for a card with the Skill trait and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
flavor:
“It’s a dangerous business, Frodo, going out of your door,” he used to say. “You step into the Road, and if you don’t keep your feet, there is no knowing where you might be swept off to.”
—Frodo, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Feast of Plenty
text: Feast of Plenty’s resource cost must be paid from a single hero’s resource pool. Action: Ready up to 3 heroes and add 1 resource to each of their resource pools. Only 1 copy of Feast of Plenty can be played by the players each round.
flavor: The feast was merry and the food all that his hunger could desire. —The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Deeping Defender
text: Devoted. Response: After Deeping Defender defends an attack, return the attacking enemy to the staging area and deal 1 damage to it.
flavor: The sunset gilded their spears and helmets, and glinted in their pale flowing hair. —The Two Towers

name: Morwen Steelsheen
text: Action: Put Morwen Steelsheen into play from your hand. Then, discard a Rohan or Gondor ally you control. Response: After a Rohan or Gondor ally leaves play, exhaust Morwen Steelsheen to either heal 2 damage from a character or reduce your threat by 1.

name: It Should Be Spared
text: Response: After a Trap card you control attaches to an enemy, return it to your hand. Then, play it from your hand for no cost.
flavor:
“But I do not slay man or beast needlessly, and not gladly even when it is needed.”
—Faramir, The Two Towers

name: Spring the Trap
text: Response: After a Trap card you control attaches to an enemy, put a Ranger ally into play from your hand.
flavor: “The road may pass, but they shall not! Not while Faramir is Captain.” —Mablung, The Two Towers

name: Squire of the Mark
text: Response: After a Rohan ally you control is discarded from play, add Squire of the Mark to the victory display to put that ally into play exhausted.
flavor: “Little service can I offer to your lord, but what I can do, I would do.” —Pippin, The Return of the King

name: Rammas Lookout
text:
Devoted.
While each hero you control has at least 1 resource in its resource pool, Rammas Lookout gets +1 [willpower] and does not exhaust to quest.
flavor:
“Whatever betide, you have come to the end of the Gondor that you have known. Let me pass!”
—Gandalf, The Return of the King

name: Théodwyn
text: Response: After Théodwyn enters play, either draw 1 card or add 1 resource to a Noble hero’s resource pool.
flavor:
“She is fearless and high-hearted. All love her. Let her be as lord to Eorlingas while we are gone.”
—Háma, The Two Towers

name: Light-footed Steed
text: Attach to a Rohan hero. Restricted. Response: After a character you control leaves play, exhaust Light-footed Steed to ready attached hero. Then, if the character that left play was unique, attached hero gets +1 [attack] until the end of the round.
flavor: “…and don’t forget their horses! They can see the night-breeze, or so it’s said.” —Ugluk, The Two Towers

name: Rammas Sentry
text: Devoted. While each hero you control has at least 1 resource in its resource pool, Rammas Sentry gains: “Response: Cancel 1 point of damage just dealt to a Gondor character. (Limit once per phase.)”
flavor:
“For if we fall, who shall stand?”
—Beregond, The Return of the King

name: Live Bait
text: Play only if you control an unattached Trap attachment. Action: Choose a non-unique enemy in play. Until the end of the round, treat the chosen enemy’s printed text box as if it were blank (except for Traits). Then, attach an unattached Trap attachment you control to that enemy.

name: Worthy of Remembrance
text: Combat Action: Discard a Rohan ally you control to choose an enemy. Deal 2 damage to that enemy (4 damage instead if the ally was unique).
flavor:
Then the heart of Éowyn changed… suddenly her winter passed, and the sun shone on her.
—The Return of the King

name: Need Brooks No Delay
text: Reduce the cost to play Need Brooks No Delay by 1 for each Rohan hero you control. Planning Action: Search the top 10 cards of your deck for a card with printed cost 2 or less (3 or less if it is unique) and set it aside. Shuffle your deck. Then, play the set aside card for no cost as if it were in your hand.

name: The Last Alliance
text: Side A Choose two traits, A and B. Each of your starting heroes and each ally in your deck must have either the printed A or B trait, but cannot have both. You must have at least 1 starting hero and 10 allies in your deck with each trait. Setup: Flip this card over. Side B While you control more A characters than B characters, reduce the cost of the first B ally you play this round by 1, and vice versa. Action: Exhaust The Last Alliance to choose a card in your hand or a card in play under your control. Replace each printed instance of “A” or “B” in that card’s ability text with “A or B” until the end of the round.
flavor:
“The strength of the Elves to resist him was greater long ago; and not all Men were estranged from them.”
—Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Fatty Bolger
text: Setup: Reduce your threat by 2. Response: Raise your threat by 4 and exhaust Fatty Bolger to cancel a non-unique enemy card just revealed from the encounter deck and add it to the victory display. (Limit once per game for the group.)
flavor: Fatty Bolger had not been idle. As soon as he saw the dark shapes creep from the garden, he knew that he must run for it, or perish. —The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Widfast
text: Setup: Search your collection for a Creature ally and add it to your hand. For the first round, reduce its cost by 2. Travel Action: If there is 1 active location, spend 1 resource from Widfast’s pool to travel to another location, resolving its Travel effect. (There are now 2 active locations.)

name: Lily Cotton
text: Action: Exhaust Lily Cotton to ready a different Hobbit ally and add Lily Cotton’s [willpower], [attack], and [defense] to that ally’s [willpower], [attack], and [defense] respectively until the end of the phase. At the end of the phase, if that ally is still in play, return it to its owner’s hand. (Limit once per phase.)
flavor:
There is little or no magic about them, except the ordinary everyday sort which helps them disappear quietly and quickly…
—The Hobbit

name: A Lesson in Caution
text: Secrecy 1. Action: Draw 1 card. Then, either reduce your threat by 2, or the next card you play this phase gains secrecy 1.
flavor: Hobbits go light, and their footprints are not easy even for a Ranger to read… —The Two Towers

name: There and Back Again
text: Secrecy 1. Response: After a Hobbit ally leaves play, search your hand and discard pile for a copy of that ally and put it into play, under any player’s control.
flavor: The legal bother, indeed, lasted for years. It was quite a long time before Mr. Baggins was in fact admitted to be alive again. —The Hobbit

name: Buckland Shirriff
text: Devoted. Ranged. Response: After an enemy that shares a Trait with an enemy in the victory display is added to the staging area, spend 1 [lore] resource to put Buckland Shirriff into play from your hand, under your control.

name: Weep No More!
text: Limit 3 copies of Weep No More! in the victory display. Response: After a “when revealed” effect or a shadow effect on a treachery card resolves, add Weep No More! to the victory display to add that treachery card to the victory display.
flavor:
“At least we may yet be avenged. Let us gird ourselves and weep no more!”
—Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Fear! Fire! Foes!
text: Secrecy 1. Play only if you do not control a Warrior hero. Action: Choose a non-unique enemy and an attribute ([threat], [attack], or [defense]). Until the end of the phase, reduce the chosen attribute of that enemy to 0.
flavor: Far away answering horns were heard. The alarm was spreading. —The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Horn-call of Buckland
text: Attach to a [lore] or Hobbit hero. Response: After you engage an enemy that shares a Trait with an enemy in the victory display, exhaust Horn-call of Buckland to ready attached hero. Then, that enemy gets −1 [attack] and −1 [defense] until the end of the round.
flavor:
At that moment, among the trees nearby, a horn rang out. It rent the night like fire on a hill-top.
—The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Young Tom
text: During the round that Young Tom enters play, enemies get +5 engagement cost.
flavor: “Not all is well there,” said Frodo, “but certainly gardeners are honoured.” —The Two Towers

name: Gavin
text: Cannot have attachments. Response: After an encounter card without surge is revealed, exhaust Gavin to give that card surge and add 1 resource to the pool of a Scout hero you control. If the next encounter card revealed is not a location, discard it without resolving its effects.

name: Alagos
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Response: After an Eagle ally enters a player’s play area, add 1 resource to the pool of a hero that player controls. (Limit once per round.)
flavor:
“What is all this uproar in the forest tonight?”
—The Lord of the Eagles, The Hobbit

name: Faunith
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Quest Action: Play an Eagle ally from your hand. Then, you may exhaust that ally to either commit it to the quest or deal 1 damage to an enemy in the staging area.
flavor: Straight down upon the Nazgûl they bore, stooping suddenly out of the high airs… —The Return of the King

name: Messenger of Manwë
text: Cannot defend or have restricted attachments. Response: After Messenger of Manwë enters your play area, give an Eagle or Noble hero you control +1 [willpower] until the end of the round. Response: After Messenger of Manwë commits to the quest, give control of it to another player.

name: Veteran Eagle
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Response: After Veteran Eagle enters your play area, each copy of Veteran Eagle you control gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round.
flavor: But eagles have keen eyes and can see small things at a great distance. —The Hobbit

name: Chieftain of the Skies
text: Devoted. Cannot have restricted attachments. Response: After Chieftain of the Skies enters your play area, ready an ally you control.
flavor: Behind them in long swift lines came all their vassals from the northern mountains. —The Return of the King

name: Box of Earth
text: Play only if you control a Noldor or Silvan hero. Attach to a hero. Action: Exhaust Box of Earth to choose a location. Place 1 progress on that location and give it the Forest trait until the end of the round.
flavor:
“It will not keep you on your road, nor defend you against any peril; but if you keep it… it may reward you.”
—Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Roving Herbmaster
text: Response: After a player reduces their threat, heal 1 damage from a character you control. Then, you may give control of Roving Herbmaster to another player. (Limit once per round.)
flavor:
“Crush one in the water, and wash the wound clean, and I will bind it. Now it is your turn.”
—Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Grip
text: Limit 1 per deck. Cannot have attachments. Each enemy in play gets +1 engagement cost. Response: After Grip enters play, search your deck for a Creature ally and add it to your hand. Until the end of the phase, that ally does not require a resource match. Shuffle your deck.

name: Fang
text: Limit 1 per deck. Cannot have attachments. Each enemy in play gets +1 engagement cost. Response: After Fang enters play, search your deck for a Creature ally and add it to your hand. Until the end of the phase, that ally does not require a resource match. Shuffle your deck.

name: Wolf
text: Limit 1 per deck. Cannot have attachments. Each enemy in play gets +1 engagement cost. Response: After Wolf enters play, search your deck for a Creature ally and add it to your hand. Until the end of the phase, that ally does not require a resource match. Shuffle your deck.
flavor: …most ferocious of the three… —The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Hidden Roosts
text: Response: When an Eagle ally leaves play, that ally’s controller reduces their threat by X, where X is the printed cost of the ally. If X is 2 or less, that player also draws 1 card.
flavor: “May the wind under your wings bear you where the sun sails and moon walks.” —Gandalf, The Hobbit

name: Breath of Arda
text: Encounter Action: Return X Eagle allies you own (under any player’s control) to your hand. Then, put each of those allies into play under any player’s control, one at a time. Remove Breath of Arda from the game.
flavor: “For we have need of speed greater than any wind.” —Gandalf, The Return of the King

name: Golden Crown
text: Attach to an Eagle hero. Attached hero gains the Noble trait. Action: Exhaust Golden Crown to choose an Eagle ally you own under any player’s control. Either give control of that ally to a different player, or discard that ally from play to add 1 resource to attached hero’s pool.

name: Guided by Fate
text: Attach to a hero. Response: When you would shuffle a set-aside card with the encounter keyword into the encounter deck, shuffle it into the top 5 cards instead. Action: If the encounter deck has 5 or more cards in it, exhaust Guided by Fate and raise your threat by 1 to shuffle the top card of the encounter discard pile into the top 5 cards of the encounter deck.

name: Barliman Butterbur
text: Response: After Barliman Butterbur takes damage from an undefended attack, draw 1 card.
flavor: “I’m run off my feet; but I’ll see what I can do for you.” —The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Nob
text: Reduce the cost of the first Item attachment you play on another Bree or Hobbit character each round by 1. Action: Exhaust Nob to draw a card. If that card is an Item attachment, ready a Bree character. (Limit once per round.)
flavor:
“Where are you, you woolly-footed slow-coach?”
—Barliman Butterbur, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Harry Goatleaf
text: Response: Cancel 1 point of combat damage just dealt to a hero you control. (Limit once per round per hero.)
flavor:
“Your business is your own, no doubt, but it’s my business to ask questions after nightfall.”
—The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Bob
text: Response: After Bob enters play, search your deck for a Mount or Pony card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
flavor:
“A poor old half-starved creature it is, but he won’t part with it for less than thrice its worth.”
—The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Bree Pony
text: Attach to a Bree or Hobbit character. Restricted. Attached character gets +1 hit point. Response: When attached character takes damage from an undefended attack, exhaust Bree Pony to reduce that damage by 1.
flavor:
No horse or pony was to be got for love or money in the neighbourhood – except one.
—The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Half-pint
text: Attach to a character. Refresh Action: Discard Half-pint to heal up to 2 damage from attached character. Then, put an Item attachment in your discard pile on the top of your deck.
flavor:
“I’ve a drop of good ale on tap, if you and your friends are willing.”
—Farmer Maggot, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Seasoned Forager
text: Attach to a hero you control. Limit 1 per player. Your heroes cannot gain resources from player card effects. Action: Exhaust Seasoned Forager to reduce the cost of the next card you play this phase that matches the attached hero’s sphere by 1.

name: Pint
text: Play only if you control a unique Bree character. Attach to a hero. Action: Exhaust Pint to heal 1 damage from attached hero. Action: Discard Pint to heal 5 damage from attached hero.
flavor: “Well, my merry folk, will you drink another draught with me before you go?” —Treebeard, The Return of the King

name: Scheming Staddler
text: Response: After an undefended attack damages a hero you control, deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy. (Limit once per phase.)
flavor: “He would sell anything to anybody; or make mischief for amusement.” —Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Bree-land Protector
text: Devoted. Response: Exhaust Bree-land Protector to cancel a shadow effect just triggered during an attack and deal the attacking enemy another shadow card. If this attack deals no damage, return Bree-land Protector to its owner’s hand after the attack.

name: A Stout Heart
text: Response: Cancel a shadow effect just triggered during an undefended attack. After this attack damages a single hero, the controller of that hero may spend 1 resource from its pool to reduce their threat by 3.
flavor:
“We come now to the very brink, where hope and despair are akin. To waver is to fall.”
—Aragorn, The Return of the King

name: Gift of Foresight
text:
Attach to a hero with at least 2 printed [willpower]. Limit 1 per hero.
Attached hero gets +2 [defense] if it has not committed to the quest this round.
flavor:
“Do not think that only by singing amid the trees, nor even by the slender arrows of elven-bows, is this land of Lothlórien maintained and defended.”
–Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Archet Alekeeper
text: Devoted. Response: After an undefended attack damages a hero you control, ready Archet Alekeeper and give it +1 [attack] until the end of the phase.
flavor: “Gave me a chance of walking round the country and seeing folk, and hearing the news, and knowing where the good beer was.” —Robin Smallburrow, The Return of the King

name: Gaeronel
flavor: “I will dwell by the grey shores, guarding the Havens until the last ship sails.” —Círdan, The Silmarillion

name: Glorfindel
text:
Glorfindel gets +2 [attack] while attacking alone.
Glorfindel gets +2 [attack] while attacking a unique enemy.
flavor:
Then Glorfindel leapt forward upon him and his golden armour gleamed strangely in the moon…
—The Fall of Gondolin

name: Harlond Lookout
text: Devoted. Response: After Harlond Lookout is destroyed, ready a character you control.
flavor: The fleets passed out of the sight of the watchers in the havens, and their lights faded. —The Silmarillion

name: Balin
text: Devoted. Response: After a card is discarded from the top of your deck, ready Balin. (Limit once per round.)
flavor: The others made no pretense of offering – except old Balin. —The Hobbit

name: Salvaged Supplies
text: Response: At the end of the refresh phase, if none of your heroes gained any resources from player card effects this round, add 1 resource to the pool of a hero you control. Action: Exhaust a character you control to return Salvaged Supplies from your discard pile to your hand.

name: Lay of the Nauglamír
text: Devoted. Action: Discard the top 10 cards of your deck. Choose up to 2 different Noldor or Dwarf allies discarded by this effect and put them into play. Each chosen ally must have a printed cost of 2 or less. You may shuffle any number of the other cards discarded by this effect back into your deck. Remove Lay of the Nauglamír from the game.

name: Wandering Spirit
text: Cannot enter play. Action: If Wandering Spirit is in your discard pile, move it up or down by 1 or 2 cards. Then, if it is next to a Noldor ally with a printed cost of 2 or less, you may spend 1 [spirit] resource and remove Wandering Spirit from the game to put that ally into play. (Limit once per round.)

name: Relic of Nargothrond
text: Attach to a Noldor or Dwarf character. Restricted. Limit 1 per character. Relic of Nargothrond can be played from your discard pile. Attached character gets +1 [defense]. Action: Discard Relic of Nargothrond to give attached character +2 [defense] until the end of the phase.
flavor: In that labour Finrod was aided by the Dwarves of the Blue Mountains. —The Silmarillion

name: Onward Into Battle
text: Attach to a Warrior hero. Encounter Action: Exhaust Onward Into Battle to ready attached hero.
flavor: “…and though we still hold that a warrior should have more skills and knowledge than only the craft of weapons and slaying, we esteem a warrior, nonetheless, above men of other crafts. Such is the need of our days.” —Faramir, The Two Towers

name: Legacy of Gondolin
text: Attach to a Noldor hero you control. Limit 1 per hero. You cannot play allies or attachments from your hand unless you have 2 or fewer cards in your hand. Action: Exhaust Legacy of Gondolin to either draw 1 card or discard Legacy of Gondolin.

name: Rowan
text: Sentinel. Response: After you play an attachment on a location, add 1 resource to the pool of a hero you control. (Limit once per round.) Quest Action: Choose a player to take control of the first player token. Each player can only be chosen once per game.

name: Osbera
text: Side A Reduce the total [threat] in the staging area by 1 for each damaged Beorning character you control (limit –5 [threat]). Response: After you engage an enemy, spend 1 resource from Osbera’s pool to flip her. Side B Cannot have restricted attachments. If you are not engaged with an enemy, flip Osbera. Response: Deal 1 damage to a Beorning character you control to cancel 2 points of damage just dealt to a character you control. (Limit once per round.)
flavor:
“I don’t need your service, thank you. But I expect you need mine.” —Beorn, The Hobbit
“Not eaten up by Wargs or goblins or wicked bears yet I see.” —Beorn, The Hobbit

name: Woodmen's Outpost
text: Attach to a location. Limit 1 per location. Response: After attached location is explored, each character controlled by the first player gets +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round.
flavor: “…even the Wargs dared not attack them if there were many together, or in the bright day.” —The Hobbit

name: Lie of the Land
text: Attach to a location. Action: Exhaust a Scout character to place 1 progress on attached location. If that location is not explored by this effect, you may attach Lie of the Land to another location.
flavor:
“We shall have to scour the lands all round for many long leagues before any move is made.”
—Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Hunting Dogs
text: Devoted. Cannot have attachments. Response: After a location with an attachment is explored, ready Hunting Dogs.
flavor:
“Hound is hungry, hare is fearful.”
—Treebeard, The Two Towers

name: Beorning Pony
text: Cannot have attachments. Response: After Beorning Pony enters play, discard the top 5 cards of your deck. Then, you may spend 1 [tactics] resource to add one of the cards discarded by this effect to your hand.
flavor: There was just room to get the ponies through with a squeeze, when they had been unpacked and unsaddled. —The Hobbit

name: Birna
text: Action: Exhaust Birna and spend 1 [tactics] resource to put a Beorning ally from your discard pile into play. At the end of the phase, if that ally is still in play or in your discard pile, shuffle it into your deck.
flavor: In that last hour Beorn himself had appeared - no one knew how or from where. —The Hobbit

name: Descendants of Beorn
text: Response: When a Beorning ally you control leaves play, add 1 resource to a Beorning hero’s pool for each damage token that was on that ally (up to that ally’s printed hit points).
flavor: He tossed wolves and goblins from his path like straws and feathers. —The Hobbit

name: Beorn's Welcome
text: Play only if you control a Beorning hero. Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero. Response: After you spend any resources from attached hero’s pool for a purpose other than paying to play a card, exhaust Beorn’s Welcome to add 1 resource to attached hero’s pool.
flavor: “I am Gandalf,” said the wizard. “Never heard of him,” growled the man. —The Hobbit

name: Subdued
text:
Attach to a damaged enemy engaged with you. Limit 1 per enemy.
Attached enemy gets −4 [attack].
flavor: His miserable enemy lay grovelling on the stones whimpering. —The Two Towers
