name: Without My Hat
text: Limit 1 copy of Without My Hat in the victory display. Action: Add Without My Hat to the victory display to search your collection for an attachment. If no copy of that attachment was in your deck during setup, add it to your hand.

name: Gilraen
text: Setup: You may choose to give Gilraen –2 [willpower] and up to 2 other Dúnedain heroes +2 [willpower] until the end of the game. Action: Turn a shadow card dealt to an enemy faceup. Then, you may deal that enemy 1 additional faceup shadow card to draw 1 card. (Limit once per phase.)
flavor:
“I gave Hope to the Dúnedain, I have kept no hope for myself.”
—The Return of the King

name: Aragorn
text: Aragorn gains a resource icon matching each Title attachment attached to him. Setup: Search your collection for a Title attachment with a printed cost of 1 and attach it to Aragorn. Action: Ready a Title attachment with a printed cost of 1 attached to Aragorn. (Limit once per round.)

name: A Fair Exchange
text: Action: Discard a unique card from your hand that shares a title with a card in play to search your deck for a different unique card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
flavor: “There is nothing like looking, if you want to find something…” —Thorin Oakenshield, The Hobbit

name: Elessar
text: Attach to a Noble hero or Aragorn. Attached character gains the Gondor trait. If attached character is Aragorn, he gains the Noble trait. Action: Exhaust Elessar to choose an ally that is defending an attack and shares a Trait with the attached character. Either ready that ally or give it +1 [defense] for that attack.
flavor:
“Say not The Lords of Gondor. Say The King Elessar.”
—Prince Imrahil, The Return of the King

name: The Renewer
text: Attach to a Gondor hero or Aragorn. Attached character gains the Healer trait. Action: Exhaust The Renewer to choose a questing ally that shares a Trait with the attached character. Either ready that ally and heal 1 damage from it or give it +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.
flavor:
“The hands of the king are the hands of a healer.”
—Ioreth, The Return of the King

name: Elendilmir
text: Guarded (location). Attach to a hero. Replace each instance of “once per phase” or “once per round” in the attached character’s text box with “twice per phase” or “twice per round” respectively. Action: Exhaust Aragorn to discard the location guarding Elendilmir. Then, attach Elendilmir to Aragorn.

name: Estel
text: Attach to a Dúnedain hero or Aragorn. Attached character gains the Noldor trait. Action: Exhaust Estel and discard 1 card from your hand to search the top X cards of your deck for 1 card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck. X is the number of Traits on the attached character.

name: Chieftain of the North
text: Attach to a Ranger hero or Aragorn. Attached character gains the Warrior trait. Action: Exhaust Chieftain of the North to choose an attacking ally that shares a Trait with the attached character. Either ready that ally or give it +1 [attack] for that attack.
flavor: “Here is Aragorn son of Arathorn, chieftain of the Dúnedain…” —Faramir, The Return of the King

name: Grey Companion
text: Sentinel. Response: When you play Grey Companion from your hand, exhaust X Title attachments you control to reduce its cost by X.
flavor: “But I did not summon you,” said Aragorn, “save only in wish.” —The Return of the King

name: Andúril
text: Attach to a hero with 4 or more Traits. Restricted. If attached hero is Aragorn, he gains a [leadership] resource icon. Attached hero gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], and +1 [defense]. Action: Exhaust Andúril to ready attached hero.
flavor: “You shall not be sheathed again until the last battle is fought.” —Aragorn, The Return of the King

name: Dáin Ironfoot
text: While Dáin Ironfoot is ready, Dwarf characters get +1 [attack] and +1 [willpower].
flavor:
"You have not heard of Dáin and the dwarves of the Iron Hills?"
-Bilbo Baggins, The Hobbit

name: Ori
text: If you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, draw 1 additional card at the beginning of the resource phase.
flavor:
"He could write well and speedily, and often used the Elvish characters."
-Gimli, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Bifur
text: Action: Pay 1 resource from a hero's resource pool to add 1 resource to Bifur's resource pool. Any player may trigger this ability. (Limit once per round.)
flavor: "And winter comes after autumn." - Bifur, The Hobbit

name: Bombur
text: Action: Exhaust Bombur to choose a location. That location gets -1 [threat] until the end of the phase. (That location does not contribute its [threat] instead if it is an Underground location.)

name: Dori
text: Response: After a hero is assigned any amount of damage, exhaust Dori to place that damage on Dori instead.
flavor:
'I can't always be carrying burglars on my back,' said Dori, 'down tunnels and up trees! What do you think I am? A porter?'
-Dori, The Hobbit

name: Erebor Hammersmith
text: Response: After you play Erebor Hammersmith, return the topmost attachment in any player's discard pile to his hand.
flavor: "In Erebor in the Kingdom of Dain there is such skill..." -Aragorn, The Return of the King

name: Erebor Record Keeper
text: Erebor ~Record Keeper cannot attack or defend. Action: Exhaust Erebor ~Record Keeper and pay 1 [lore] resource to choose and ready a Dwarf character.

name: Ered Luin Miner
text: Response: After Ered Luin Miner is discarded from your deck, put it into play under your control.
flavor:
Tools were to be found in plenty that the miners and quarriers and builders of old had used; and at such work the dwarves were still very skilled.
-The Hobbit

name: Ered Nimrais Prospector
text: Response: After Ered Nimrais Prospector enters play, discard the top 3 cards of your deck. Then, choose and shuffle 1 card from your discard pile back into your deck.

name: Gandalf
text: At the end of the round, discard Gandalf from play. Response: After Gandalf enters play, (choose 1): draw 3 cards, deal 4 damage to 1 enemy in play, or reduce your threat by 5.

name: Glóin
text: While you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, Glóin gains: 'Response: After you play Glóin from your hand, choose a hero. Add 2 resources to that hero's resource pool.'
flavor:
Glóin lit several more torches, and then they all crept out, one by one...
-The Hobbit

name: Longbeard Elder
text: Response: After Longbeard Elder commits to a quest, look at the top card of the encounter deck. If that card is a location, place 1 progress token on the current quest. Otherwise, Longbeard Elder gets -1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

name: Miner of the Iron Hills
text: Response: After Miner of the Iron ~Hills enters play, choose and discard 1 Condition attachment from play.
flavor:
...while the four dwarves sat around the table, and talked about mines and gold and troubles with goblins...
-The Hobbit

name: Cram
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Discard Cram to ready attached hero.

name: Healing Herbs
text: Attach to a [lore] hero. Action: Discard Healing Herbs and exhaust attached hero to heal all damage on 1 character.

name: King Under the Mountain
text: Attach to a Dwarf hero. Action: Exhaust King Under the Mountain to look at the top 2 cards of your deck. Add 1 to your hand and discard the other.
flavor:
"Long ago in my grandfather Thror's time our family was driven out of the far North, and came back with all their wealth and tools to this Mountain on the map."
-Thorin, The Hobbit

name: Legacy of Durin
text: Attach to a Dwarf hero. Response: After you play a Dwarf character from your hand, exhaust Legacy of Durin to draw 1 card.

name: Narvi's Belt
text: Attach to a Dwarf hero. Action: Exhaust Narvi's Belt to give attached hero a [leadership], [lore], [tactics], or [spirit] icon until the end of the phase.

name: Thrór's Map
text: Attach to a hero. Travel Action: Discard Thrór's Map to choose a location in the staging area. Make that location the active location. (If there is another active location, return it to the staging area.)
flavor: "This was made by Thrór, your grandfather, Thorin." he said in answer to the dwarves' excited questions. "It is a plan of the Mountain." -Gandalf, The Hobbit

name: A Very Good Tale
text: Action: Exhaust 2 allies you control to shuffle your deck and discard the top 5 cards. Put up to 2 allies discarded by this effect into play under your control. The total cost of the allies put into play cannot exceed the total cost of the allies exhausted to pay for this effect.

name: Hidden Cache
text: Response: After Hidden Cache is discarded from your deck, add 2 resources to the resource pool of a hero you control. Action: Spend 1 resource to draw 1 card.
flavor:
...there was a good deal of food jumbled carlessly on shelves and on the ground, among an untidy litter of plunder...
-The Hobbit

name: Lure of Moria
text: Action: Ready all Dwarf characters.

name: We Are Not Idle
text: Action: Exhaust X Dwarf heroes to add X resources to a hero's resource pool and draw 1 card.
flavor:
"You should see the stone-paved roads of many colours! And the halls and cavernous streets under the earth with arches carved like trees; and the terraces and towers upon the Mountain's sides! Then you would see that we have not been idle."
-Glóin, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Durin's Song
text: Action: Choose a Dwarf hero. That hero gets +2 [willpower], +2 [attack], and +2 [defense] until the end of the round.
flavor:
A king he was on carven throne
In many-pillared halls of stone
With golden roof and silver floor,
And runes of power upon the door.
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Nori
text: Response: After you play a Dwarf character from your hand, reduce your threat by 1.
flavor:
"Nori, at your service."
-Nori, The Hobbit

name: Kili
text: Response: After you play Kili from your hand during the planning phase, search your deck for Fili and put him into play under your control. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Fili
text: Response: After you play Fili from your hand during the planning phase, search your deck for Kili and put him into play under your control. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Zigil Miner
text: Action: Exhaust Zigil Miner and name a number to discard the top 2 cards of your deck. If at least one of those cards has cost equal to the named number, choose a hero you control. For each card that matches the named number, add 1 resource to that hero's resource pool.

name: Erebor Guard
text: Sentinel. Response: When you play Erebor Guard from your hand, discard the top 2 cards of your deck to reduce its cost by 2.
flavor:
...the fortress of the dwarves could not be taken by surprise.
-The Hobbit

name: Dwarf Pipe
text: Attach to a Dwarf character. Limit 1 per character. Response: After a card is discarded from your deck, exhaust ~Dwarf ~Pipe to place that card on the bottom of your deck.
flavor:
He held up a small pipe with a wide flattened bowl...
-The Two Towers

name: Magic Ring
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero and 1 per deck. Action: Exhaust Magic ~Ring and raise your threat by 1 to (choose 1): heal 1 damage from attached hero, add 1 resource to attached hero's pool, or ready attached hero.
flavor:
"In Eregion long ago many Elven-rings were made, magic rings as you call them, and they were, of course, of various kinds..."
-Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Celeborn
text: Response: After a Silvan ally enters play, that ally gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round.
flavor: "...the lord of the Galadhrim is accounted wisest of the Elves of Middle-earth, and a giver of gifts beyond the power of kings." -Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Galadriel
text: Galadriel cannot quest, attack, or defend. Allies you control do not exhaust to commit to the quest during the round they enter play. Action: Exhaust Galadriel to choose a player. That player reduces his threat by 1 and draws 1 card. (Limit once per round.)

name: Haldir of Lórien
text: Ranged. Combat Action: If you have not engaged an enemy this round, exhaust Haldir of Lórien to declare him as an attacker (and resolve his attack) against an enemy not engaged with you. (Limit once per round.)

name: Defender of the Naith
text: Sentinel. Response: After a Silvan ally you control leaves play, ready Defender of the Naith.
flavor: "We have been keeping watch on the rivers, ever since we saw a great troop of Orcs going North toward Moria..." -Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Galadhrim Minstrel
text: Response: After Galadhrim Minstrel enters play, search the top five cards of your deck for an event card and add it to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
flavor: ...the language was that of Elven-song and spoke of things little known on Middle-earth. -The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Galadriel's Handmaiden
text: Response: After Galadriel's Handmaiden enters play, choose a player. That player reduces his threat by 1.
flavor: Her maidens stood silent about her, and a while she looked upon her guests. -The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Gandalf
text: At the end of the round, discard Gandalf from play. Response: After Gandalf enters play, (choose 1): draw 3 cards, deal 4 damage to 1 enemy in play, or reduce your threat by 5.

name: Greenwood Archer
text: Ranged. Response: After Greenwood Archer enters play, ready a hero.
flavor:
They dwelt most often by the edges of the woods, from which they could escape at times to hunt...
-The Hobbit

name: Henamarth Riversong
text: Action: Exhaust Henamarth Riversong to look at the top card of the encounter deck.
flavor:
"And I reckon there's Elves and Elves. They're all elvish enough, but they're not all the same."
-Sam Gamgee,
The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Mirkwood Runner
text: While Mirkwood Runner is attacking alone, the defending enemy does not count its [defense].
flavor: "...let a ploughman plough, but choose an otter for swimming, and for running light over grass and leaf or over snow-an Elf." -Legolas, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Naith Guide
text: Response: After Naith Guide enters play, choose a hero. That hero does not exhaust to quest this round.
flavor: "...I shall lead you well..." -Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Orophin
text: Ranged. Response: After Orophin enters play, return a Silvan ally from your discard pile to your hand.
flavor:
"Orophin has now gone in haste back to our dwellings to warn our people."
-Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Silvan Refugee
text: Forced: After a character leaves play, discard Silvan Refugee from play.
flavor: "The Elves have their own labours and their own sorrows..." -Gildor, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Silvan Tracker
text: Response: After a Silvan character readies during the refresh phase, heal 1 damage from that character.
flavor: "The Wood-elves tracked him first, an easy task for them, for his trail was still fresh then." -Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Rings

name: Lembas
text: Play only if you control a Noldor or Silvan hero. Attach to a hero. Action: Discard Lembas to ready attached hero and heal 3 damage from it.
flavor: "...it is more strengthing than any food made by Men, and it is more pleasant than cram, by all accounts. -Lórien Elf, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Nenya
text: Attach to Galadriel. She gains a [lore] resource icon. Quest Action: Exhaust Nenya and Galadriel to add her [willpower] to another character's [willpower] until the end of the phase.
flavor: "The is Nenya, the Ring of Adamant, and I am its keeper." -Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: O Lórien!
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Exhaust O Lorien! to lower the cost of the next Silvan ally played this phase by 1 (to a minimum of 1).
flavor:
"I sang of leaves, of leaves of gold, and
leaves of gold there grew:
Of wind I sang, a wind there came and in the
branches blew." -Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Wingfoot
text: Attach to a Ranger hero. Response: After attached hero commits to a quest, name enemy, location or treachery. If a card of the named type is revealed during this quest phase, exhaust Wingfoot to ready attached hero.
flavor:
"Wingfoot I name you. This deed of the three friends should be sung in many a hall. Forty leagues and five you have measured ere the forth day is ended!"
-Éomer, The Two Towers

name: A Test of Will
text: Response: Cancel the 'when revealed' effects of a card that was just revealed from the encounter deck.
flavor:
"There is naught that you can do, other than to resist, with hope or without it"
-Elrond, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Daeron's Runes
text: Action: Draw 2 cards. Then, discard 1 card from your hand.
flavor:
"These are Daeron's Runes, such as were used of old in Moria..."
-Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Elrond's Counsel
text: Action: If you control a unique Noldor character, give another character +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase and lower your threat by 3.

name: Feigned Voices
text: Combat Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to choose an enemy engaged with a player. That enemy cannot attack that player this phase.
flavor: "The three of us could not challenge a hundred, so we went ahead and spoke with feigned voices, leading them on into the wood." -Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Host of Galadhrim
text: Planning Action: Return each Silvan ally you control to your hand. Then, play each of those allies from your hand one at a time at no cost.
flavor:
Celeborn came forth and led the host of Lórien...
-The Return of the King

name: The Tree People
text: Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to search the top 5 cards of your deck for a Silvan ally. Put that ally into play and shuffle the other cards back into your deck. You can only play 1 copy of The Tree People each phase.
flavor: No folk could they see, nor hear any feet upon the paths; but there were many voices, about them, and in the air above. –The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Galadhon Archer
text: Ranged. Response: After Galadhon Archer enters play, deal 1 damage to an enemy not engaged with you.
flavor: "...they say that you breathe so loud that they could shoot you in the dark." -Legolas, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Rúmil
text: Ranged. Response: After you play Rúmil from your hand, choose an enemy engaged with a player. Deal X damage to that enemy where X is the number of ranged characters you control.
flavor: ...the Company set out again, guided now by Haldir and his brother Rúmil. -The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Bow of the Galadhrim
text:
Attach to a Silvan character with the ranged keyword. Restricted.
Attached character gets +1 [attack]. (+2 [attack] instead if attacking an enemy not engaged with you.)
flavor: ...longer and stronger than the bows of Mirkwood, and strung with a string of elf-hair. -The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Hands Upon the Bow
text: Action: Exhaust a character you control with ranged to immediately declare it as an attacker (and resolve its attack) against an enemy in the staging area. It gets +1 [attack] during this attack.

name: Pursuing the Enemy
text: Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to choose a player. Deal 1 damage to each enemy engaged with that player.
flavor: The marauding orcs had been waylaid and almost all destroyed; the remnant had fled westward towards the mountains, and were being pursued. -The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Vilya
text: Attach to Elrond. He gains a [spirit] resource icon. Action: Exhaust Elrond and Vilya to reveal the top card of your deck. You can immediately play or put into play the revealed card for no cost, if able. Otherwise, move the revealed card to the bottom of your deck.
flavor: ...mightiest of the Three. -Return of the King

name: Elrond
text: You may spend resources from Elrond's resource pool to pay for [spirit], [leadership], and [tactics] allies. Response: After a character is healed by another card effect, heal 1 damage on it.
flavor:
"But you do not stand alone."
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Boromir
text: While Boromir has at least 1 resource in his resource pool, Gondor allies get +1 [attack].
flavor: "By our valour the wild fold of the East are still restrained, and the terror of Morgul kept at bay..." -The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Prince Imrahil
text: Response: After a character leaves play, ready Prince Imrahil. (Limit once per round.)
flavor: But beyond, in the great fief of Belfalas, dwelt Prince Imrahil in his castle of Dol Amroth by the sea, and he was of high blood, and his fold also, tall men and proud with sea-grey eyes. -The Return of the King.

name: Mablung
text: Response: After you engage an enemy, add 1 resource to Mablung's resource pool. (Limit once per phase.)
flavor:
But the Captains of the West were well warned by their scouts, skilled men from Henneth Annûn led by Mablung...
-The Return of the King

name: Angbor the Fearless
text: While your threat is 40 or higher, Angbor the Fearless gets +2 [attack] and does not exhaust to quest.
flavor:
"Four thousands I sent marching from Pelargir through Lossarnach two days ago; and Angbor the fearless rides before them."
-Aragorn, The Return of the King

name: Soldier of Gondor
text: Response: After Soldier of ~Gondor enters play, seach the top 5 cards of your deck for a Gondor ally and add it to your hand (any number of Gondor allies instead if your threat is 40 or higher). Shuffle your deck.

name: Citadel Custodian
text: Lower the cost to play Citadel Custodian by 1 for each Gondor ally in play.

name: Defender of Rammas
flavor: "And the Enemy must pay dearly for the crossing of the River." -Denethor, The Return of the King

name: Pelargir Ship Captain
text: Response: After Pelargir Ship Captain enters play, move 1 resource from the resource pool of a hero you control to another hero's resource pool.

name: Errand-rider
text: Action: Exhaust Errand-rider to move 1 resource from the resource pool of a hero you control to another hero's resource pool.
flavor: For the people of the City used horses very little and they were seldom seen in their streets, save only those ridden by the errand-riders of their lord. -The Return of the King

name: Faramir
text: Action: Exhaust Faramir to choose a player. Each character controlled by that player gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.
flavor:
"He leads now in all perilous ventures. But his life is charmed, or fate spares him for some other end."
-Mablung, Ranger of Ithilien,
The Two Towers

name: Gandalf
text: At the end of the round, discard Gandalf from play. Response: After Gandalf enters play, (choose 1): draw 3 cards, deal 4 damage to 1 enemy in play, or reduce your threat by 5.

name: Gondorian Spearman
text: Sentinel. Response: After Gondorian Spearman is declared as a defender, deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy.
flavor: More than a thousand were there mustered. Their spears were like a springing wood. -The Two Towers

name: Envoy of Pelargir
text: Response: After Envoy of Pelargir enters play, add 1 resource to a Gondor or Noble hero's resource pool.

name: Squire of the Citadel
text: Response: After Squire of the Citadel leaves play, add 1 resource to a Gondor hero's resource pool.
flavor:
As he spoke he struck a small silver gong that stood near his footstool, and at once servants came forward.
-The Return of the King

name: Captain of Gondor
text: Attach to a Warrior hero. Response: After you optionally engage an enemy, exhaust ~Captain of ~Gondor to give attached hero +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round.
flavor: "Boromir it was that drove the enemy at last back from this western shore..." -Beregond, The Return of the King

name: Gondorian Shield
text:
Attach to a hero. Restricted.
Limit 1 per hero.
Attached hero gains +1 [defense]. (+2 [defense] instead if attached hero has the Gondor trait.)
flavor: There flowered a White Tree, and that was for Gondor... -The Return of the King

name: Heir of Mardil
text: Attach to a Noble hero. Response: After attached hero gains any number of resources from a card effect, exhaust Heir of Mardil to ready attached hero.
flavor:
"...in my turn I bore it, and so did each eldest son of our house, far back into the vanished years before the failing of the kings..."
-Denethor, The Return of the King

name: Steward of Gondor
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains the Gondor trait. Action: Exhaust Steward of Gondor to add 2 resources to attached hero's resource pool.
flavor: "It was commanded yesterday." -Denethor, The Return of the King

name: Valiant Sword
text:
Attach to a Noble hero. Limit 1 per hero.
Restricted.
Attached hero gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] if your threat is 40 or higher).
flavor:
...his sword of steel was valiant...
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Visionary Leadership
text:
Attach to a Gondor hero.
While attached hero has at least 1 resource in its resource pool, Gondor characters get +1 [willpower].
flavor: "...still the lords of Gondor have keener sight than lesser men..." -Denethor, The Return of the King

name: Behind Strong Walls
text: Action: Ready a defending Gondor character. That character gets +1 [defense] until the end of the phase.
flavor: ...seven walls of stone so strong and old that it seemed to have been not builded by carven by giants out of the bones of the earth. -The Return of the King

name: Feint
text: Combat Action: Choose an enemy engaged with a player. That enemy cannot attack that player this phase.
flavor: A few brave men were strung before them to make a feint of resistance, and many there fell before the rest drew back and fled to either side. -The Hobbit

name: Need Drives Them
text: Action: Each player whose threat is 40 or higher readies all characters he controls.

name: Pillars of the Kings
text: While your threat is less than 40, reduce the cost to play Pillars of the Kings by 4. Action: Set your threat to 40. If this effect raised your threat, draw a card (draw 4 cards instead if it raised your threat by 10 or more).
flavor:
"Behold the Argonath, the Pillars of the Kings!"
-Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Valiant Sacrifice
text: Response: After an ally card leaves play, that card's controller draws 2 cards.
flavor:
"He fell defending the Hobbits, while I was away upon the hill."
-Aragorn, The Two Towers

name: Foe-hammer
text: Response: After a hero you control attacks and destroys an enemy, exhaust a Weapon card attached to that hero to draw 3 cards.
flavor:
It burned with a rage that made it gleam if goblins were about; now it was bright as blue flame for delight in the killing of the great lord of the cave.
-The Hobbit

name: Beregond
text:
Sentinel.
Lower the cost to play Weapon and Armor attachments on Beregond by 2.
flavor: "It is over-late to send for aid when you are already besieged." -The Return of the King

name: Faramir
text:
Ranged.
Faramir gets +1 [attack] for each enemy in the staging area.
flavor:
"The road may pass, but they shall not! Not while Faramir is Captain."
-Mablung, The Two Towers

name: Emyn Arnen Ranger
text: Response: After Emyn Arnen ~Ranger commits to the quest, choose an enemy with a Trap attachment. Until the end of the phase, Emyn Arnen ~Ranger gets +X [willpower], where X is the chosen enemy's printed [threat].

name: Ranger Spikes
text: Play Ranger Spikes into the staging area unattached.If unattached, attach Ranger Spikes to the next eligible enemy that enters the staging area.Players do not make engagement checks against attached enemy. Attached enemy gets -2 [threat].

name: Ithilien Pit
text:
Play ~Ithilien Pit into the staging area unattached.
If unattached, attach ~Ithilien Pit to the next eligible enemy that enters the staging area.
Any character may choose attached enemy as the target of an attack.

name: Coney in a Trap
text: Play only if you control a unique character with the Ranger trait and another unique character with the Warrior trait. Response: After you engage an enemy, that enemy cannot attack you until the end of the round.

name: Helm of Secrecy
text: Limit 1 per deck. Action: Choose a hero you control and discard all tokens from it. Select a different non-[fellowship], non-[baggins] hero from your collection with a threat cost less than or equal to the chosen hero. Swap those heroes, moving all eligible attachments to the hero from your collection.

name: Path of Need
text:
Limit 1 per deck. Attach to a location.
Heroes do not exhaust to attack, defend, or commit to a quest while attached location is the active location.
flavor:
"However it may prove, one must tread the path that need chooses!"
-Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Éomer
text: Response: After a character leaves play, Éomer gets +2 [attack] until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)
flavor: "I am named Éomer son of Éomund, and am called the Third Marshal of Riddermark." -The Two Towers

name: Hirgon
text: Response: After Hirgon quests successfully, play a [tactics] ally from your hand, reducing its cost by 1 (to a minimum of 1). Then, you may raise your threat by 1 to give that ally +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round.
flavor:
"Hirgon I am, errand-rider of Denethor, who bring you this token of war."
-The Return of the King

name: Lothíriel
text: If Éomer is in play, Lothíriel gains the Rohan trait. Response: After Lothíriel commits to a quest, choose an ally in your hand. If that ally shares a Trait with her, put that ally into play exhausted and committed to the quest. At the end of the phase, if that ally is still in play, shuffle it into your deck.

name: Éomund
text: Response: After Éomund leaves play, ready all Rohan characters in play.
flavor: "You I have not seen before, for you are young, but I have spoken with Éomund your father..." -Aragorn, The Two Towers

name: Escort from Edoras
text: While committed to a quest, Escort from Edoras gets +2 [willpower]. Forced: After resolving a quest to which Escort from Edoras was committed, discard Escort from Edoras from play.

name: Gandalf
text: At the end of the round, discard Gandalf from play. Response: After Gandalf enters play, (choose 1): draw 3 cards, deal 4 damage to 1 enemy in play, or reduce your threat by 5.

name: Guthlaf
text:
If there is at least 1 Rohan hero in play, lower the cost to play Guthlaf by 1.
If there is at least 1 Gondor hero in play, Guthlaf gains sentinel.

name: Horseback Archer
text: Ranged.
flavor: A few of the riders appeared to be bowmen, skilled at shooting from a running horse. -The Two Towers

name: Riddermark Knight
text: Response: After Riddermark Knight is declared as an attacker, it gets +2 [attack] for this attack. At the end of this attack, discard Riddermark Knight.

name: West Road Traveller
text: Response: After you play West Road Traveller from your hand, switch the active location with any other location in the staging area.
flavor: The dark world was rushing by, and the wind sang loudly in his ears. -The Return of the King

name: Westfold Horse-breaker
text: Action: Discard Westfold Horse-breaker to choose and ready a hero.
flavor: "Your own valour has done more, and the stout legs of the Westfold-men marching through the night." -Gandalf, The Two Towers

name: Westfold Horse-breeder
text: Response: After Westfold Horse-breeder enters play, search the top 10 cards of your deck for a Mount attachment and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
flavor: "They love their horses next to their kin." -Boromir, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Westfold Lancer
text: Response: After Westfold Lancer quests successfully, discard it to choose a non-unique enemy in the staging area. Deal 2 damage to the chosen enemy.
flavor:
...the white fury of the Northmen burned the hotter, and more skilled was their knighthood with long spears...
-The Return of the King

name: Westfold Outrider
text: Action: Discard Westfold Outrider to choose an enemy not engaged with you. Engage the chosen enemy.
flavor: "Erkenbrand of Westfold has drawn off those men he could gather towards his fastness at Helm's Deep. The rest are scattered."-Rider of Rohan, The Two Towers

name: Ancient Mathom
text: Attach to a location. Response: After attached location is explored, the first player draws 3 cards.
flavor: The Mathom-house it was called; for anything that Hobbits had no immediate use for, but were unwilling to throw away, they called a mathom. Their dwellings were apt to become rather crowded with mathoms... -The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Firefoot
text: Attach to a [tactics] or Rohan hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead if attached hero is Éomer). Response: After attached hero attacks alone, exhaust Firefoot to choose a non-unique enemy engaged with you. Excess damage dealt by this attack is assigned to the chosen enemy.

name: Horn of the Mark
text: Attach to a Rohan hero or Merry. Restricted. Response: When a character leaves play, if that character shares at least one trait with the attached hero, exhaust Horn of the Mark to draw 1 card.
flavor:
Then Éowyn gave to Merry an ancient horn, small but cunningly wrought all of fair silver with a baldric of green.
-The Return of the King

name: The Red Arrow
text: Limit 1 per deck. Attach to a Gondor hero. Attached hero gets +1 [willpower]. Valour Response: After attached hero quests successfully, add The Red Arrow to the victory display to search the top 5 cards of your deck for an ally and put it into play.
flavor:
"The Red Arrow has not been seen in the Mark in all my years!"
-Théoden, The Return of the King

name: War Axe
text:
Attach to a [tactics] character. Limit 1 per character. Restricted.
Attached characters gets +1 [attack] for each attachment it has with the restricted keyword.
flavor:
"Gimli Glóin's son, have you your axe ready?"
-Éomer, The Return of the King

name: A Test of Will
text: Response: Cancel the 'when revealed' effects of a card that was just revealed from the encounter deck.
flavor:
"There is naught that you can do, other than to resist, with hope or without it"
-Elrond, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Astonishing Speed
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, all Rohan characters get +2 [willpower].
flavor: With astonishing speed and skill they checked their steeds, wheeled, and came charging round. -The Two Towers

name: Feint
text: Combat Action: Choose an enemy engaged with a player. That enemy cannot attack that player this phase.
flavor: A few brave men were strung before them to make a feint of resistance, and many there fell before the rest drew back and fled to either side. -The Hobbit

name: Forth Eorlingas!
text: Combat Action: Each Rohan hero can be declared as an attacker against enemies in the staging area this phase.
flavor: "Oaths ye have taken: now fulfill them all, to lord and land and league of friendship!" -Théoden, The Return of the King

name: Oath of Eorl
text: Play only if you control a unique character with the Rohan trait and another unique character with the Gondor trait. Response: At the beginning of the combat phase, you resolve the step in which you attack enemies before resolving enemy attacks this phase. (Each other player resolves the combat phase as normal after you resolve your attacks.)

name: The Muster of Rohan
text: While paying for The Muster of ~Rohan, each Rohan hero you control is considered to have a [spirit] icon. Planning Action: ~Search the top 10 cards of your deck for up to 4 Rohan allies and put them into play. Shuffle your deck. If any of those allies are still in play at the end of the round, discard them.

name: Wait no Longer
text: Response: At the beginning of the quest phase, search the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for an enemy and put it into play engaged with you. Then, reveal 1 less encounter card this phase (to a minimum of 0). Shuffle the encounter deck.
flavor:
"We must press our Enemy, and no longer wait upon him for the move."
-Aragorn, The Return of the King

name: Fastred
text: Response: After Fastred defends an enemy attack, return that enemy to the staging area to reduce your threat by 2. (Limit once per phase.)
flavor:
"King's man! King's man!" his heart cried within him.
-The Return of the King

name: The Riddermark's Finest
text: Action: Exhaust and discard The Riddermark's Finest to place 2 progress tokens on any location.
flavor:
"And there are no horses like the ones that are bred in that great vale between the Misty Mountains and the White."
-Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: Spear of the Mark
text:
Attach to a Rohan character. Restricted.
Attached character gets +1 [attack]. (+2 [attack] instead if attacking an enemy in the staging area).
flavor: Right through the press drove Théoden Thengel's son, and his spear was shivered as he threw down thier chieftan. -The Return of the King

name: Steed of the Mark
text: Attach to a Gondor or Rohan hero. Response: after attached hero commits to a quest, spend 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to ready attached hero.
flavor: ...fresh horses were always in readiness to bear his errand-riders to Rohan in the Noth... -The Return of the King

name: Rohan Warhorse
text: Attach to a [tactics] or Rohan hero. Restricted. Response: After attached hero participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, exhaust Rohan Warhorse to ready attached hero.
flavor: Their horses were of great stature, strong and clean-limbed... -The Two Towers

name: Charge of the Rohirrim
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, each Rohan character with a Mount attachment gets +3 [attack].
flavor: "Arise, arise, riders of Théoden!" -Théoden, The Return of the King

name: A Perilous Voyage
text: Side A Your minimum deck size is 100 cards. Your threat cannot be reduced by player card effects. Action: Exhaust this card and raise your threat by 1 to look at the top 2 cards of your deck, draw 1, and place the other on the bottom of your deck. Forced: When you would be eliminated by reaching your threat elimination level, flip this card over instead. Side B Your threat cannot be reduced by non-contract player card effects. Heroes you control do not exhaust to quest. Forced: When this card is flipped to this side, reduce your threat by 10. Search your deck for a card and either add it to your hand or play it, reducing its cost by 3. Shuffle your deck.
flavor:
Thus came Aragorn... borne upon a wind from the Sea to the kingdom of Gondor...
-The Return of the King

name: Stalking Goblin
text: Forced: After Stalking Goblin engages you, search the encounter deck, discard pile, and your collection (in that order) for a Goblin Sniper and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. Shadow: Add Stalking Goblin to the staging area.

name: Shiny Distraction
text: Surge. Doomed 1. When Revealed: Each player may add 1 resource to each of their heroes' pools. Each player that does raises their threat by 5.

name: Guilty Conscience
text: Surge. When Revealed: Attach to the hero with the highest threat cost. (Counts as an Adaptation attachment with the text: "Forced: Raise your threat by 2 at the end of each round. Action: Spend 2 resources from attached hero's pool to discard this card.")

name: The Fervor of Lore
text: Setup. Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains the [lore] resource icon. Action: Choose and discard 3 cards from your hand to heal all damage from a hero. (Limit once per campaign. Record in Campaign Log when used.)

name: The Might of Tactics
text: Setup. Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains the [tactics] resource icon. Action: Deal 1 damage to the attached hero to deal 3 damage to an enemy engaged with you. (Limit once per campaign. Record in Campaign Log when used.)

name: The Power of Spirit
text: Setup. Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains the [spirit] resource icon. Action: Exhaust the attached hero to place 3 progress on a location. (Limit once per campaign. Record in Campaign Log when used.)

name: The Secret of Leadership
text: Setup. Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains the [leadership] resource icon. Action: Spend 1 resource from the attached hero's resource pool to ready a hero. (Limit once per campaign. Record in Campaign Log when used.)

name: "No Time to Waste!"
text: When playing this card, choose one: Quest Action: Remove "No Time to Waste!" from the game and from the Campaign Pool to reduce each player's threat by 3. Reveal the top card of the encounter deck. Quest Action: Draw 1 card.

name: Ranger Sense
text: When playing this card, choose one: Action: Remove Ranger Sense from the game and from the Campaign Pooll to look at the top 4 cards of your deck. Add 1 to your hand and put the rest back in any order. Action: Draw 1 card.

pack_name: ALeP - The Scouring of the Shire
name: Frodo Baggins
text: The first player gains control of Frodo Baggins. Response: After Frodo Baggins is declared as a defender, spend 1 [fellowship] resource to reduce your threat by the attacking enemy’s [threat]. Until the end of the round, that enemy cannot take damage. If Frodo Baggins leaves play, the players lose the game.

pack_name: ALeP - The Scouring of the Shire
name: Star-like Gem
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gets +1 [willpower]. If attached hero is a Hobbit, it does not exhaust to quest.
flavor:
“When the memory of the fear and the darkness troubles you, this will bring you aid.”
—Arwen, The Return of the King

pack_name: ALeP - The Scouring of the Shire
name: Bright Mail
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gets +1 [defense] (+2 [defense] instead if attached hero is a Hobbit).
flavor: “They wouldn’t go for armed folk, with swords and helmets and shields and all. Make them think twice, that would.” —Barliman Butterbur, The Return of the King

pack_name: ALeP - The Scouring of the Shire
name: Scatha's Horn
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Exhaust Scatha’s Horn to choose an attacking enemy. Until the end of the phase, that enemy gets −1 [attack] (−2 [attack] instead if the defending character is a Hobbit hero).
flavor: “He that blows it at need shall set fear in the hearts of his enemies.” —Éowyn, The Return of the King

pack_name: ALeP - The Scouring of the Shire
name: Heightened Stature
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains +2 hit points (+3 hit points instead if attached hero is a Hobbit). Action: Exhaust Heightened Stature to heal 1 damage from attached hero.
flavor:
“Mortals cannot go drinking ent-draughts and expect no more to come of them than of a pot of beer.”
—Gimli, The Return of the King

pack_name: ALeP - The Scouring of the Shire
name: Into the West
text: Side A You cannot use this contract unless you have destroyed The One Ring and won The Scouring of the Shire in campaign mode. Your deck must contain an equal number of cards with a printed cost of 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5. Setup: Search the top 10 cards of your deck for an ally with a printed cost of 3 or less and put it into play. Shuffle your deck and flip this card over. Side B Into the West is immune to the effects of other cards and cannot leave your control or leave play. Allies you play from your hand cannot have their cost reduced by more than 2. Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, attach Into the West to an ally you control, if able. Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, distribute X resources among heroes you control, where X is the attached card’s printed cost. Remove the attached card from the game and draw 1 card.
flavor: “I tried to save the Shire, and it has been saved, but not for me.” —Frodo Baggins, The Return of the King

name: At the End of All Things
text: Side A You can only choose 2 starting heroes. They each get +4 threat cost, +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], +1 [defense], +1 hit point, and they each gain a resource icon matching the other hero’s printed sphere. They cannot gain resources from attachment card effects, and they cannot be healed. Action: Exhaust At the End of All Things to deal 1 damage to one of your starting heroes and ready your other starting hero. Action: Flip this card over. You cannot trigger this effect during the first 3 rounds. Side B Your starting heroes each get +4 threat cost, +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], +1 [defense], +1 hit point, and they each gain a resource icon matching the other hero’s printed sphere. They cannot gain resources from attachment card effects. Forced: When this card flips to this side, add 3 resources to each of your starting heroes’ pools. Search your deck for 2 cards and add them to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

name: (MotK) Faramir
text: Action: Exhaust Faramir to choose a player. Each character controlled by that player gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.
flavor:
"He leads now in all perilous ventures. But his life is charmed, or fate spares him for some other end."
<cite>Mablung, Ranger of Ithilien,
The Two Towers</cite>

name: (MotK) Brok Ironfist
text: Response: After a Dwarf hero you control leaves play, put Brok Ironfist into play from your hand.
flavor:
...there is no knowing what a Dwarf will not dare and do for revenge and the recovery of his own.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>

name: (MotK) Beorn
text: Action: Beorn gains +5 [attack] until the end of the phase. At the end of the phase in which you trigger this effect, shuffle Beorn back into your deck. (Limit once per round.)
flavor: "I don't need your service, thank you...but I expect you need mine." <cite>The Hobbit</cite>

name: (MotK) Henamarth Riversong
text: Action: Exhaust Henamarth Riversong to look at the top card of the encounter deck.
flavor:
"And I reckon there's Elves and Elves. They're all elvish enough, but they're not all the same."
<cite>Sam Gamgee,
The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: (MotK) Gléowine
text: Action: Exhaust Gléowine to choose a player. That player draws 1 card.
flavor:
Then the Riders of the King's House upon white horses rode round about the barrow and sang together a song of Théoden Thengel's son that Gléowine his minstrel made...
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: (MotK) Éomund
text: Response: After Éomund leaves play, ready all Rohan characters in play.
flavor: "You I have not seen before, for you are young, but I have spoken with Eomund your father..." <cite>Aragorn, The Two Towers</cite>

name: (MotK) Landroval
text: Sentinel. Landroval cannot have restricted attachments. Response: After a hero card is destroyed, return Landroval to his owner's hand to put that hero back into play, with 1 damage token on it. (Limit once per game.)

name: (MotK) Haldir of Lórien
text: Ranged.ÿSentinel.
flavor: "But there are some of us still who go abroad for the gathering of news and the watching of our enemies, and they speak the languages of other lands." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: (MotK) Gildor Inglorion
text: Action: Exhaust Gildor Inglorion to look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Switch one of those cards with a card from your hand. Then, return the 3 cards to the top of your deck, in any order.
flavor: "Go not to the Elves for counsel, for they will say both no and yes." <cite>Frodo Baggins, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: (MotK) Elfhelm
text: While Elfhelm is ready, he gains: "Response: After your threat is raised as the result of questing unsuccessfully, or by an encounter or quest card effect, reduce your threat by 1."
flavor: "Buy my lord sends word that we must set ourselves in readiness: orders may come for a sudden move." <cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: (MotK) Bofur
text: Quest Action: Spend 1 [spirit] resource to put Bofur into play from your hand, exhausted and committed to a quest. If you quest successfully this phase and Bofur is still in play, return him to your hand.
flavor: "Get up lazy-bones..." <cite>The Hobbit</cite>

name: (MotK) Bombur
text: Action: Exhaust Bombur to choose a location. That location gets -1 [threat] until the end of the phase. (That location does not contribute its [threat] instead if it is an Underground location.)

name: (MotK) Arwen Undómiel
text: Response: After Arwen Undómiel exhausts, choose a character. That character gains sentinel and gets +1 [defense] until the end of the round.
flavor:
...in whom it was said that the likeness of Lúthien had come on earth again...for she was the Evenstar of her people.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: (MotK) Erestor
text: Action: Choose and discard 1 card from your hand to draw 1 card. (Limit once per round.)
flavor:
Beside Glorfindel there were several other counsellors of Elrond's household, of whom Erestor was the chief...
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: (MotK) Damrod
text: Action: Discard Damrod from play to lower your threat by 1 for each enemy in the staging area.

name: (MotK) Forlong
text: While you control Outlands allies that belong to 4 different spheres, ready Forlong at the beginning of each phase.
flavor: "Forlong!" men shouted. "True heart, true friend!" <cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: (MotK) Denethor
text:
Denethor gets -1 [willpower] for each damaged hero you control.
Discard Denethor if his [willpower] is 0 or less.
flavor: "Denethor is of another sort, proud and subtile, a man of far greater lineage and power, though he is not called a king." <cite>Gandalf, The Return of the King</cite>

name: (MotK) Guthlaf
text: If there is at least 1 Rohan hero in play, lower the cost to play Guthlaf by 1. If there is at least 1 Gondor hero in play, Guthlaf gains sentinel.

name: (MotK) Emery
text: Action: Discard the top 3 card of your deck to put Emery into play from your hand, under any player's control. Then, if any of the discarded cards have the [tactics], [lore] or [leadership] sphere, discard Emery.

name: (MotK) Anborn
text: Action: Exhaust Anborn to return 1 Trap card from your discard pile to your hand.
flavor:
"I sent my keenest huntsmen to seek him, but he slipped them, and they had no sight of him till now, save Anborn."
<cite>Faramir, The Two Towers</cite>

name: (MotK) Rúmil
text: Ranged. Response: After you play Rúmil from your hand, choose an enemy engaged with a player. Deal X damage to that enemy where X is the number of ranged characters you control.
flavor: ...the Company set out again, guided now by Haldir and his brother Rúmil. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: (MotK) Gwaihir
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Response: After Gwaihir enters play, search your discard pile for an Eagle ally and put it into play under your control. At the end of the round, if that ally is still in play, add it to your hand.
flavor: "The North Wind blows, but we shall outfly it." <cite>Gwaihir, The Return of the King</cite>

name: (MotK) Orophin
text: Ranged. Response: After Orophin enters play, return a Silvan ally from your discard pile to your hand.
flavor: "Orophin has now gone in haste back to our dwellings to warn our people." <cite>Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: (MotK) Ingold
text: Ingold gets +1 [willpower] for each hero you control with at least 1 resource in its resource pool.
flavor:
"We wish for no strangers in the land at this time, unless they be mighty men of arms in whose faith and help we can trust."
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: (MotK) Galdor of the Havens
text: Response: After 1 or more cards are discarded from your hand, draw 1 card. Limit once per round.
flavor:
"But have they the strength, have we here the strength to withstand the Enemy, the coming of Sauron at the last, when all else is overthrown?"
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: (MotK) Beechbone
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted. Response: After Beechbone is declared as an attacker, deal 1 damage to him to deal X damage to the defending enemy. X is the amount of damage on Beechbone.

name: (MotK) Lindir
text: Response: After Lindir enters play, if you have less than 3 cards in your hand, draw until you have 3 cards in your hand.
flavor:
"To sheep other sheep no doubt appear different," laughed Lindir. "Or to shepherds. But Mortals have not been our study. We have other business."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: (MotK) Éothain
text: Response: After a Rohan ally is discarded from play by a card effect, ready Éothain.
flavor:
"We must hasten south, lord. Let us leave these wild folk to their fancies. Or let us bind them and take them to our king."
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: (MotK) Azain Silverbeard
text: Response: After Azain Silverbeard participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, spend 1 [tactics] resource to deal 2 damage to another enemy that shares a Trait with the destroyed enemy. Any player may trigger this response.

name: (MotK) Glorfindel
text: Glorfindel can be played from your discard pile. Action: Discard a card from your hand to ready Glorfindel. (Limit once per phase.)
flavor:
"He is an Elf-lord of a house of princes."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: (MotK) Eldahir
text: Sentinel. Action: Spend 1 [lore] resource to look at a facedown shadow card dealt to an engaged enemy. If that card has a shadow effect, Eldahir gets +2 [defense] until the end of the phase. Any player may trigger this action. (Limit once per phase.)

name: (MotK) Sam Gamgee
text: Reduce the cost to play Sam Gamgee by 2 if you control Frodo Baggins. Response: After a player raises his threat, that player may spend 1 [spirit] resource to ready Sam Gamgee. He gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)

name: (MotK) Ceorl
text: Spend 1 [spirit] resource to ready Ceorl. Then, you may give control of Ceorl to another player. Any player may trigger this action. (Limit once per phase).
flavor:
He drew himself up. Then he knelt, offering his notched sword to the king. "Command me, lord!" he cried. 
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: (MotK) Déorwine
text: Sentinel. Action: While Déorwine is defending, spend 1 [leadership] resource to cancel a shadow effect dealt to the attacking enemy. Any player may trigger this action.

name: (MotK) Robin Smallburrow
text: Response: After you travel to a location, spend 1 [spirit] resource to raise the engagement cost of each enemy in play by X until the end of the round, where X is that location's quest points. Any player may trigger this response.
flavor:
"Gave me a chance of walking round the country and seeing folk, and hearing the news, and knowing where the good beer was."
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: (MotK) Ioreth
text: Cannot attack or defend. Action: Spend 1 [lore] resource and exhaust Ioreth. Then, heal 3 points of damage on a character. Any player may trigger this action.
flavor: Thus spake Ioreth, wise-woman of Gondor: The hands of the king are the hands of a healer, and so shall the rightful king be known. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: (MotK) Súlien
text: Action: Spend 1 [lore] resource to exhaust Súlien. Then, each location in the staging area gets ?1 [threat] until the end of the phase. Any player may trigger this action.

name: (MotK) Fili
text: Response: After you play Fili from your hand during the planning phase, search your deck for Kili and put him into play under your control. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: (MotK) Kili
text: Response: After you play Kili from your hand during the planning phase, search your deck for Fili and put him into play under your control. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: (MotK) Bofur
text: Action: Exhaust Bofur to search the top 5 cards of your deck for 1 Weapon attachment. Add that card to your hand and shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

name: (MotK) Dori
text: Response: After a hero is assigned any amount of damage, exhaust Dori to place that damage on Dori instead.

name: (MotK) Glóin
text: While you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, Glóin gains: "Response: After you play Glóin from your hand, choose a hero. Add 2 resources to that hero's resource pool."
flavor: Glóin lit several more torches, and then they all crept out, one by one... <cite> The Hobbit </cite>

name: (MotK) Bifur
text: While you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, Bifur gains: "Response: After you play Bifur from your hand, draw 2 cards."
flavor: "My cousins! Bombur and Bofur <cite> we have forgotten them, they are down in the valley!" ?The Hobbit</cite>

name: (MotK) Dwalin
text: Sentinel. While you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, lower the cost to play Dwalin by 2.

name: (MotK) Bill the Pony
text: Cannot have attachments. Lower the cost to play Bill the Pony by 2 if you control Sam Gamgee. Each Hobbit character gets +1 hit point.
flavor: "He gave me a look as plain as Mr. Pippin could speak it: if you don't let me go with you, Sam, I'll follow on my own" <cite>Sam Gamgee, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: (MotK) Barliman Butterbur
text: If each hero you control has the Hobbit trait, damage from undefended attacks against you may be assigned to Barliman Butterbur.
flavor: "But spooks or no spooks, they won't get in The Prancing Pony so easy." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: (MotK) Farmer Maggot
text: Response: After Farmer Maggot enters play, deal 1 damage to an enemy engaged with you. (Deal 2 damage instead if that enemy's engagement cost is higher than your threat.)
flavor: "It is lucky for you that I know you. I was going out to set my dogs on any strangers." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: (MotK) Galadriel
text: At the end of the round, discard Galadriel from play. Response: After you play Galadriel from your hand, search the top 5 cards of your deck for an attachment of cost 3 or less and put it into play. Put the remaining cards back in any order.

name: (MotK) Boromir
text: Boromir gets +2 [defense] while defending against an enemy with an engagement cost higher than your threat. Response: After Boromir takes any amount of damage, ready him.

name: (MotK) Elrond
text: At the end of the round, discard Elrond from play. Response: After Elrond enters play, choose one: heal all damage on a hero, discard a Condition attachment, or each player draws 1 card.

name: (MotK) Bilbo Baggins
text: Response: After Bilbo Baggins enters play, search your deck for a Pipe attachment and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
flavor: "Elves may thrive on speech alone, and Dwarves endure great weariness, but I am an old Hobbit, and I miss my meal at noon." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>

name: (MotK) Gimli
text: Sentinel. Response: After an enemy is revealed from the encounter deck, ready Gimli.
flavor:
"Give me a row of orc-necks and room to swing and all weariness will fall from me!"
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: (MotK) Legolas
text: Ranged. Response: After Legolas participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, draw 1 card.
flavor: "He stands not alone," said Legolas, bending his bow and fitting an arrow with hands that moved quicker than sight. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: (MotK) Quickbeam
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted. Response: After Quickbeam enters play, deal 1 damage to him to ready him.
flavor: "I am Bregalad, that is Quickbeam in your language. But it is only a nickname, of course." <cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: (MotK) Háma
text: Combat Action: Ready Háma. He gets +3 [defense] until the end of the phase. At the end of the phase, discard Háma. (Limit once per round.)
flavor: "I am the Doorward of Théoden," he said. "Háma is my name." <cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: (MotK) Anborn
text: Response: After an enemy is added to the staging area, exhaust Anborn to give that enemy +5 engagement cost until the end of the round. Then, deal 1 damage to that enemy.
flavor: "Now I have him at arrow-point." <cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: (MotK) Mablung
text: Response: After Mablung enters play, choose an enemy to get +5 engagement cost until the end of the round. Then, you may engage that enemy, or return it to the staging area.
flavor: "But still we will not sit idle and let Him do all as He would." <cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: (MotK) Skinbark
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted. While Skinbark is attacking alone against an Orc enemy, that enemy does not count its [defense].
flavor: "He was wounded by the Orcs, and many of his folk and his tree-herds have been murdered and destroyed." <cite>Treebeard, The Two Towers</cite>

name: (MotK) Gamling
text: Response: After a Rohan ally you control is discarded from play, exhaust Gamling to return that ally to your hand.
flavor: "...we have a thousand fit to fight on foot," said Gamling, an old man, the leader of those that watched the Dike. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>

name: (MotK) Grimbold
text: Combat Action: Discard Grimbold to choose an enemy engaged with a player. That enemy cannot attack that player this phase.
flavor:
Grimbold's men turned aside and passed round to a great gap in the wall further eastward.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: (MotK) Prince Imrahil
text: While there is a hero in your discard pile, Prince Imrahil loses the ally card type and gains the hero card type.
flavor:
"We must gather all of the strength that we can find."
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: (MotK) Halbarad
text:
Reduce the cost to play Halbarad by 1 for each enemy engaged with you.
Each enemy engaged with you gets +10 engagement cost.
flavor:
"Halbarad Dúnadan, Ranger of the North I am..."
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: (MotK) Ghân-buri-Ghân
text: X is the [threat] of the active location. Travel Action: Discard Ghân-buri-Ghân to travel to a location without resolving its Travel effect.
flavor:
"Ghân-buri-Ghân will not lead you into trap."
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: (MotK) Rosie Cotton
text: Action: Exhaust Rosie Cotton to choose a Hobbit hero and an attribute ([willpower], [attack], [defense]). Add Rosie Cotton's [willpower] to that hero's chosen attribute until the end of the phase. (Limit once per phase.)
flavor: "?take care of yourself, and come straight back as soon as you have settled the ruffians!" <cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: (MotK) Elfhelm
text: Action: Spend 1 resource from a Rohan hero's resource pool to put Elfhelm into play from your hand under your control. At the end of the phase, discard Elfhelm if he is still in play.
flavor: "...my lord sends word that we must set ourselves in readiness; orders may come for a sudden move." <cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: (MotK) Elladan
text: While Elrohir is in play, Elladan gets +2 [attack]. After you optionally engage an Orc enemy, ready Elladan.
flavor: ...they rode often far afield with the Rangers of the North, forgetting never their mother's torment in the dens of the Orcs. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: (MotK) Elrohir
text: While Elladan is in play, Elrohir gets +2 [defense]. After you optionally engage an Orc enemy, ready Elrohir.
flavor: "From the North we came with this purpose, and from Elrond our father we brought this very counsel." <cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: (MotK) Yazan
text: Ranged. Response: After Yazan is declared as an attacker, deal 1 damage to a non-unique enemy in play. (Limit once per phase.)
flavor:
...he and his knights still held themselves like lords in whom the race of Númenor ran true.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>

name: (MotK) Jubayr
text: Sentinel. Response: After Jubayr exhausts to defend an attack, discard 1 facedown shadow card from a non-unique enemy. (Limit once per phase.)

name: (MotK) Firyal
text: Response: After Firyal commits to the quest, look at the top card of the encounter deck. Then, you may discard the looked at card.

name: (MotK) Leaflock
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted. Leaflock gets +1 [willpower] for each damaged Ent character you control. (Limit +4 [willpower].)
flavor: "Leaflock has grown sleepy, almost tree-ish, you might say?" Treebeard, The Two Towers

name: (MotK) Halfast Gamgee
text: Reduce the cost to play Halfast Gamgee by 1 for each side quest in the victory display. Response: After Halfast Gamgee enters play, add 1 resource to a hero's resource pool.
flavor: "He works for Mr. Boffin at Overhill and goes up to the Northfarthing for the hunting." -Sam Gamgee, The Fellowship of the Ring

name: (MotK) Wiglaf
text: Response: After you play Wiglaf, play an Item attachment on him from your hand for no cost. Action: Exhaust an attachment on Wiglaf to ready him. (Limit once per phase.)

name: (MotK) Meneldor
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Response: After Meneldor enters or leaves play, place 2 progress on a location.
flavor: ...Meneldor young and swift. -The Return of the King

name: (MotK) Galion
text: Cannot attack or defend. Response: After Galion enters play, he gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the round.
flavor:
"Here am I waiting and waiting down here, while you fellows drink and make merry and forget your tasks. Small wonder if I fall asleep from weariness!"
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>

name: (MotK) Gaffer Gamgee
text: Combat Action: Return Gaffer Gamgee to your hand to choose an enemy with engagement cost higher than your threat. Until the end of the round, that enemy cannot attack you.
flavor: "Why? Why?s none of my business, or yours." ?The Fellowship of the Ring

name: (MotK) Merry
text: Response: After Merry enters play, each unique ally you control gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the round.
flavor:
"Shire-folk have been so comfortable so long they don"t know what to do. They just want a match, though, and they"ll go up in fire."
-The Return of the King

name: (MotK) Pippin
text: Pippin gets +2 [attack] while attacking an enemy with an engagement cost higher than your threat. Response: After you engage an enemy with an engagement cost higher than your threat, ready Pippin.
flavor:
"Down on your knees in the road and ask pardon, or I will set this troll"s bane in you!"
-The Return of the King

name: (MotK) Faramir
text: Response: After Faramir enters play, choose a non-unique enemy in the staging area. Engage that enemy and deal 2 damage to it (4 damage instead if it has an attachment on it).
flavor:
"There will be hard handstrokes nigh at hand ere the day is full."
-The Two Towers

name: (MotK) Derufin
text: Ranged. Ranged. Response: After Derufin participates in an attack which destroys an enemy engaged with a player, discard Derufin to reduce the engaged player's threat by X, where X is the destroyed enemy's printed [threat].

name: (MotK) Angbor the Fearless
text: While your threat is 40 or higher, Angbor the Fearless gets +2 [attack] and does not exhaust to quest.
flavor:
"Four thousands I sent marching from Pelargir through Lossarnach two days ago; and Angbor the fearless rides before them."
-Aragorn, The Return of the King

name: (MotK) Nori
text: Response: After Nori participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, put the top card of your discard pile on the bottom of your deck.
flavor:
"You've left the burglar behind again!"
-Nori, The Hobbit

name: (MotK) Odo Proudfoot
text: Response: After Odo Proudfoot enters play, search the top 5 cards of your deck for a Hobbit ally and add it to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
flavor:
"ProudFEET! shouted an elderly hobbit from the back of the pavilion.
-The Fellowship of the Ring

name: (MotK) Haleth
text: Response: After Haleth quests successfully, search the top 5 cards of your deck for an attachment and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

pack_name: ALeP - Messenger of the King Allies
name: (MotK) Morwen Steelsheen
text: Action: Put Morwen Steelsheen into play from your hand. Then, discard a Rohan or Gondor ally you control. Response: After a Rohan or Gondor ally leaves play, exhaust Morwen Steelsheen to either heal 2 damage from a character or reduce your threat by 1.

pack_name: ALeP - Messenger of the King Allies
name: (MotK) Théodwyn
text: Response: After Théodwyn enters play, either draw 1 card or add 1 resource to a Noble hero’s resource pool.
flavor:
“She is fearless and high-hearted. All love her. Let her be as lord to Eorlingas while we are gone.”
—Háma, The Two Towers

pack_name: ALeP - Messenger of the King Allies
name: (MotK) Lily Cotton
text: Action: Exhaust Lily Cotton to ready a different Hobbit ally and add Lily Cotton’s [willpower], [attack], and [defense] to that ally’s [willpower], [attack], and [defense] respectively until the end of the phase. At the end of the phase, if that ally is still in play, return it to its owner’s hand. (Limit once per phase.)
flavor:
There is little or no magic about them, except the ordinary everyday sort which helps them disappear quietly and quickly…
—The Hobbit

pack_name: ALeP - Messenger of the King Allies
name: (MotK) Young Tom
text: During the round that Young Tom enters play, enemies get +5 engagement cost.
flavor: “Not all is well there,” said Frodo, “but certainly gardeners are honoured.” —The Two Towers

pack_name: ALeP - Messenger of the King Allies
name: (MotK) Gavin
text: Cannot have attachments. Response: After an encounter card without surge is revealed, exhaust Gavin to give that card surge and add 1 resource to the pool of a Scout hero you control. If the next encounter card revealed is not a location, discard it without resolving its effects.

pack_name: ALeP - Messenger of the King Allies
name: (MotK) Grip
text: Limit 1 per deck. Cannot have attachments. Each enemy in play gets +1 engagement cost. Response: After Grip enters play, search your deck for a Creature ally and add it to your hand. Until the end of the phase, that ally does not require a resource match. Shuffle your deck.

pack_name: ALeP - Messenger of the King Allies
name: (MotK) Fang
text: Limit 1 per deck. Cannot have attachments. Each enemy in play gets +1 engagement cost. Response: After Fang enters play, search your deck for a Creature ally and add it to your hand. Until the end of the phase, that ally does not require a resource match. Shuffle your deck.

pack_name: ALeP - Messenger of the King Allies
name: (MotK) Wolf
text: Limit 1 per deck. Cannot have attachments. Each enemy in play gets +1 engagement cost. Response: After Wolf enters play, search your deck for a Creature ally and add it to your hand. Until the end of the phase, that ally does not require a resource match. Shuffle your deck.
flavor: …most ferocious of the three… —The Fellowship of the Ring

pack_name: ALeP - Messenger of the King Allies
name: (MotK) Bob
text: Response: After Bob enters play, search your deck for a Mount or Pony card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
flavor:
“A poor old half-starved creature it is, but he won’t part with it for less than thrice its worth.”
—The Fellowship of the Ring

pack_name: ALeP - Messenger of the King Allies
name: (MotK) Balin
text: Devoted. Response: After a card is discarded from the top of your deck, ready Balin. (Limit once per round.)
flavor: The others made no pretense of offering – except old Balin. —The Hobbit

pack_name: ALeP - Messenger of the King Allies
name: (MotK) Birna
text: Action: Exhaust Birna and spend 1 [tactics] resource to put a Beorning ally from your discard pile into play. At the end of the phase, if that ally is still in play or in your discard pile, shuffle it into your deck.
flavor: In that last hour Beorn himself had appeared - no one knew how or from where. —The Hobbit
